URm91rKl1Xi73BQXDJ-CcQ.text: A really nice soul food place. A lot of other soul food restaurants in Las Vegas have very cramped dining rooms (Gritz, Seven Seas) but this place is very spacious, clean and the walls are covered with art, family photos and posters of Black heroes like Martin Luther King Jr and President Obama.  I want to give this place three stars. The food was pre-made and reheated in a microwave, but it was still good. Still, it's always disappointing to have your plate of soulfood goodness put down in front of you and your mac and cheese is still holding the same shape as the container it was stored in.  I'm giving them four stars because of the ambiance and their stellar service. Our waiter appeared to be working the place by himself but he was attentive, very polite and knowledgeable about the menu. He offered a discount if we gave a great Yelp review, so think of that when you look at other reviews.  One dining partner ordered the veggie plate, which is basically cornbread and your choice of three sides. One of her three sides chosen was fried cabbage and our waiter stated it's made with turkey bacon (there is a sign up that says their food is made w/turkey instead of pork when possible). She was disappointed but I think its great that they're at least trying to cut back on sodium and fat by using healthier alternatives.  2nd dining partner had the meatloaf which included two sides. 3rd dining partner had  the oxtails smothered in gravy that were so delicious he threatened violence if we dared to touch his plate when he went outside to take a phone call.  I had the spicy chicken sandwich with a side of mac and cheese. I always order mac and cheese at any soul food place I go to; it's not a real soul food restaurant unless you have bomb-ass mac and cheese. EllaEm's was good, but nothing I'd go out of my way to eat again. Since it was reheated, it wasn't melty and gooey, but it wasn't bad either. The chicken was spicy, crunchy and a nice piece of meat, but the only thing on my bread was tomato and lettuce. No sauce, no nothing, not even mayo. I hope I'm not the only one who thinks that's odd.  I'm not itching to go back, but this place is definitely worth a second try.

Re_sM1Eh5IDwGp8nRh2cVw.text: Came on Father's Day to check out the menu items as I was looking for some soul food. I had the catfish, Mac cheese, greens, and mashed potatoes. The catfish was great, the mashed potatoes were delicious. I had the chicken gravy on my mashed potatoes. The Mac cheese was very disappointing as were the greens. The greens had too much of the stems left on them and the Mac cheese was dry and no cheese flavor. The server was really nice but unfortunately the service was extremely slow. They should also greet guest when they come in as we were unsure if we should stand in line and place the order for here or if we should sit and wait for the server. The servers kept passing us by while we sat so my daughter stood in line and then asked if we had to give the order and then sit down. Other guest were confused as well. I will still come again but may just have my order to go.

QJTax9MobixgGdIOUWKVqw.text: Hands down best soul food joint I've had yet. There are still a couple I haven't tried in Vegas. So as of now this place takes the lead!  They are voted "Best soul food restaurant in Las Vegas" and they do live up to that reputation. When you first walk in, it's kind of small but had a homey comfy feel. The ladies there were very warm and welcoming. Advising us we can take a seat where ever we feel comfortable. Service was excellent. Someone came and got our drinks and order real quick.  I ordered the smothered chicken, white meat. It comes with 3 sides & also cornbread. I got -- mashed potatoes, greens, & Mac n cheese. And oh my goodness. The mashed potatoes were one of the best I ever had. Idk what they put in it but it was so creamy and the gravy accented the mashed potatoes just right. The greens were pretty alright, nothing special about them though. Mac n cheese was da bomb! It had just the right amount of cheesiness. Now let me tell you about the chicken! The chicken was perfection. Even tho it was fried, it wasn't dry, it was so moist! I do recommend getting the white meat instead of dark because it does make a difference on the taste.   The beau got the chicken and waffles. It doesn't come with sides but it does come with 3 chicken wings, eggs (your choice of how it's cooked) & comes with corn bread as well. The portions are large so he could barely finish his 3rd chicken. He loved and thought the chicken was delicious as well.   I'm impressed with this restaurant & will probably return when I need a little Soul in me. Lol

I hate getting a cold plate of food. The catfish was cooked so Right, not all greasy but fried perfectly. The greens and yams for SOOOOO delicious. The corn was the perfect amount of sweet, just Delicious and they serve it with room temp butter, not cold butter. Cold butter with bread doesn't make sense to me. The mac n cheese was just okay to me but only because I've had some phenomenal mac n cheese homemade. It was clean, the staff was courteous and helpful.   If you are in Vegas take the detour off the strip and hit this place up. They were named the best soul food restaurant in the Las Vegas area but I've been to several places in L.A. and they have been the best so far.   YUMMMMMYYY!

mb23DAiNJiQIjd7bHFSdoA.text: EllaEm's has always been a must visit spot every time I've visited Las Vegas. This Sunday was an unusual experience. The staff and customers are friendly as always but, the kitchen took the day off. Ticket times ran slow and quality was not how I remembered. The pork chops plate has been my favorite dish to order the past 6 years but what I was served had to have been the toughest pork chops in the city. Not to mention the price increase over the years. Sad for me to say but EllaEm's just lost my favorite spot in Las Vegas.

GKehSFOobzSNjNlOMTZBww.text: AMAZING!!!  I love this place! Red Snapper or Fried Chicken, greens, yams & Mac n cheese is what I usually get and it's . I've dined in twice and called in a take out order maybe 3 times both experiences went well. Customer service was great and my order is always served as requested. Check them out, you won't be disappointed!

rRs_chD8BdhwY1s62le7YQ.text: Update from a year ago; my last visit since and now possibly my last visit for anything other than the catfish. I ordered to go today and the cabbage and red beans were not at all what you expect for "southern food". The red beans and rice tasted like a lot tomato sauce and seasoning salt over some ranch style or canned beans and very packaged tasting and not even zatarrains . We had cabbage as a side and it was just like they opened a bag of chopped cabbage from the salad section and tossed it in a vinaigrette dressing and quick cook microwave bacon and microwaved it together. It was not cooked down very much and quite crunchy. I tried giving them a chance since I was already passed another spot that gives us more consistency in quality and service. Ella Ems must have gone through some changes in the kitchen staff or something. It tasted like there were some corners cut this time. Two stars for the catfish in this overall experience.

GLtowVMsiL6Fx1atU2biMA.text: I just left and I had a HORRIBLE experience! The waitress named AVE was so incredibly rude! She  repeatedly walked passed my husband and I barely acknowledged us. She eventually took our drink  order and never brought us our drinks. She was very talkative to other patrons. She brought us corn bread muffins and then went to take other people's take out orders as they walked in. No one else offered to take our order. Plus, it was empty. As she was at the register I went to her and said we have been sitting here and no one has taken our order. She proceeds to tell me that they are in the middle of a shift change and she thought someone else was helping us. Uh... she was. Duh! Never brought our drinks and then sat in my face and lied and when I was like I don't want to wait any longer she gives me the hand and tells me to have a nice day. Doing all of this in front of the owner's duaghter. I did let her know that I want happy with the extremely poor customer service I received. I do not think I will be going back there. Just because of the poor service my husband and I received today!

_7qMb_93YkE3thMJczL_vg.text: On April 20 2019 I arrived at this establishment to purchase food for myself and son we waited about 10 minutes to place the order to pay 17.99 for a red snapper dinner and 14.99 plus and additional 1.99 for white meat on a Smothered Chicken dinner. After waiting about another 20 minutes I get my to go order and if I would not have checked my bags none of my side orders which consists of collard greens yams and cabbage was not in the bag. I asked the person putting my things in the bag where my sides where she turned around with and attitude and so on here they are and placed them in bag. I told her oh my I would have got all the way home which is approximately 20 minutes from the location and been upset if my things that I paid for where not in the bag she rolled her eyes and said will that be all. I got home and my chicken was terribly dry my dressing was also terribly dry to the point I could barely swallow the food. This is the most terrible experience at a Soul food Restaurant any where I've ever been. And we only received to pieces of Fish for 17.99 unbelievable. Never Again in Life. And I have to drive back another 20 minutes to receive a refund.

T8v7EcpHTUQqpjDsm1BdLA.text: My friend and I have been wanting to try this place for awhile now. The food was pretty good but a word to the wise--don't come here if you're in any sort of hurry. It took us over 45 minutes to get our food AFTER we ordered.   We showed up a few minutes after they opened at 11:00am. The service was a little bit slow. It that's ok--my friend and I hadn't seen each other for a few weeks so we were busy catching up. We both decided on their lunch special--you get your main dish and then two sides. My friend had the fried catfish with mac and cheese and potato salad. Lemme tell you--that potato salad may be the best one I've ever had!  I chose the meatloaf with mac and cheese and fried cabbage.  With the meatloaf you have the choice of having it with gravy or a tomato sauce. Per the servers recommendation, I had mine with the tomato sauce. It wasn't bad...but I think I would have liked the gravy better. The mac and cheese...I had such high hopes for it and it definitely fell short. There wasn't much taste it at all.  The fried cabbage was dang tasty though--probably my favorite part of the meal.   All in all, it wasn't a bad experience.  I'd go back again but it's not a place I'm going to be like "omg...we have to go here again, again and again".

gT7xBIRCzR-8bCuXfEmVxw.text: Started with cornbread that was awesome.  Food was hot  and delicious. Fried Okra was the best I've had in years.

OIIg4iGyI_IhOEa2RhCHGA.text: Are there any decent Soul Food restaurants in Vegas??? I've slowly lost any remaining hope after stopping in at EllaEm's. SOUL is something that our food most definitely was missing that evening  When we arrived, the restaurant was very clean and looked more inviting than other soul food spots we've dined at(Kathy's, M&M)even the items on the menu looked very appetizing....Looks were definitely deceiving here because after our waitress assured us that everything was delicious, wifey asked "are your ribs juicy and fall-off-the-bone?" "Oh yeah" she replied with a smile...about 10 seconds later, wifey sees liver and onions on the menu and she excitedly orders that instead. "Oh, you know what? that's the only item we don't have" waitress says.... Gee, thanks for the "heads up" on what you're out of.  So she orders the Ribs with 3 sides-mashed potatoes, yams, and mac and cheese and I go with one of their house specialities, Chicken and Waffles. While waiting for our order, we hear BEEP, BEEP, BEEP at least 4-5 times...yes,  that dreadful sound of the microwave was a definite"Oh hell's no!" moment....The cornbread comes out first, but not in huge squares as pictured in the menu, but more like 3-inch circles, 1/2 inch high....WTH? 4 and 5 star reviews????Really????  Some dude named Pedro was the only cook in the kitchen and I know for a fact, he didn't even take the time nor the patience to turn out tasty Soul Food....makes you wonder how much truth there is to the EllaEm's story and its two patriarchs, Ella Rea Gray, and Aem Upachak(photo of story included)  All of the sides and the waffles were definitely nuked,which made the waffles tough and spongy and the ribs were tough, dried out and not juicy at all. We won't be  coming back here...ever. Serving food like that is totally doing the two matriarchs a great injustice...ALOHA!!!  YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(25/365) "No soul at all"

BSywxUIXtnLpNQgTFRCy9Q.text: First off, I loved the whole atmosphere of this place! It's a real small, family owned spot that's kind of tucked away in a shopping center and easy to miss. This may just be me but the interior has a 50's diner kinda feel with the red & chrome which I thought was cool. They also keep their restaurant really clean and that's a huge plus.  We ended up going fry crazy haha. I went with the catfish and my wife picked the fried chicken, and let me tell you...they know how to fry food at this place! Both the chicken and fish were fried completely even to a perfect gold brown. The catfish was unbelievable! It's cooked just right with that "oh, so good" tender flakiness and their seasoning is dead on. Not too heavy with a little kick and just enough flavor to compliment the fish. The chicken was pretty dang good too but it had a slight flour taste which could probably even out with a little more salt. They aren't skimpy with portions either...alongside the fish or chicken, you get 3 sides and cornbread. Their mac n cheese is just ok but they have really good greens, red beans and the cornbread was definitely up in the top compared to most places in town.  Easily one of the top spots to go to if you're looking for good fried food! They have amazing food with a good selection and with the portions you get, the price is hard to beat. We went in at about 8pm on Friday and they were getting slammed with customers so I really think they could benefit from staying open a little later. It felt like we were being slightly rushed which is why I'd give them 4 stars but I'll definitely be coming back for more!

FnhJZjyPezeXC9uvcCAkPA.text: In one word: inconsistent. It's so frustrating too because the food that is good is VERY good but other things that you think should be an easy lock in for any southern or soul food place aren't. Customer service is questionable at best...  The fried chicken, VERY GOOD. Crispy skin, juicy, etc. The mashed potatoes, VERY BAD. Lumpy, super thick, clumpy etc. Yams=yummy, greens, meh. Their meatloaf and side of veggies YUM!! Cornbread cakes - get extra lol. Their ribs have great flavor but the beef tastes "cheap" and/or frozen for too long. Their customer service has been friendly exactly half the time too lol - out of four visits fielding my way through the menu I'm not sure I want to go back because the customer service is so inconsistent. In fairness, one time I believe the cook or dishwasher (both?) took my order himself -- either way, there's a reason that some people are better at back of the house than front of the house. I think this place has great potential but even after sampling several things I'm still utterly undecided so I hope this helps you more than it's helped me lol.

wHJGq4AqqrY60LtK1gb0lA.text: The food and service is completely awesome.. This place has the best soul food in Las Vegas. I'm talking about monster plates of collard greens, mac n cheese, porkchops and chicken. Their cornbread is sweet and very delicious. I'm looking forward of paying this place another visit. They will always let you walk out with your tummies hanging out of your shirts.

ul-sD8C9JX2yI5gjUgXJCA.text: My trip to Ella Em's was delightful. Not to mention, I brought with me a friend from the South. She enjoyed herself too!  I got the fried shrimp and she got the baked chicken. Not too greasy and the chicken slipped right off the bone.. It was amazing!   My sides were fried okra, steamed veggies and rice and gravy. All of them were delicious. The steamed veggies were a treat because they tasted fresh and not mushy in any way.  We got a to go box and they got us water to go which was so sweet of them because it's over 113 degrees outside. They even left a sweet note on my bill. Definitely look forward to coming back here!

Oq_lCS95Q96i_FaKNOLotQ.text: I live in Vancouver, WA a city not known for soulfood. Whenever I travel, its important for me to find a soulfood restaurant.. EllaEm's hit the spot!  The first night I had porkchops, cabbage, dressing and cranberry sauce (no one ever has cranberry sauce). The second night (I had to come back) my meal was meatloaf, yams, greens, red beans and rice.  The portions are so large that you have enough food for three meals. The flavor was excellent! If that wasn't enough, the hospitality and care from Pedro, Neyda, Jazz and Ms. Luxury would keep anyone coming back. Kindness goes a long way!! If you are in the Las Vegas area stop by EllaEm's, they won't disappoint.

2rnfCPVStmOKGjxzTGF8jg.text: Was craving soul food and tried this place. The servers were friendly. The place had a decent crowd. The food is cooked to order so there was a bit of a wait. Don't go there if you want to be in and out. Call in your order if you're in a rush. We had the cat fish and snapper. It satisfied my craving for fried food without smelling up my house. It will do in a pinch.

XeWCWWVwxE3uD7nahAscog.text: The Catfish & Fries were good. The sides as a whole needs some help. The Fried Cabbage lacked flavor. The Potato Salad was dry. My boyfriend said his Red Beans & Rice was missing the Rice and the Red Beans tasted like Bbq Beans. The Yams were delish. The ambience could have been better for I was taken aback when I heard R. Kelly's "Sex Me" beating through the speakers of the restaurant! I called our waitress Jazz over to complain about the choice of music and how disturbed I was. To my shock and horror she replied, "I'm team R Kelly!" Needless to say i was forced to listen to the rapey song play out while being reminded of all the victims stories. Please educate and train your staff accordingly. Thanks

CSvOMCorg9W5k-nUZD5b6g.text: This was an awesome find, we had a hankering for fried chicken and yelp found us EllaEm's. Me and my sister stopped in for lunch, around noon it was perfect timing before the crowd started coming in.   We both ordered the Chicken wing and waffle special with 2 eggs. There is a bit of wait before the food actually came out (15 mins +) but they immediately brought corn muffins and generously replenished it after we scarfed it down. Goodness those muffins are soooo deliciously warrrrmm  The waffle was fluffy and warm (I prefer it a little more crispy) the chicken was moist and crispy thumbs up. The eggs cooked over easy also thumbs up. Mac and cheese was simple - cheesy and warm loved it. Side of rice & gravy (chicken) piping hot and good. They provided ranch and hot sauce so we were happy kids.  The service was amazing, Jazz was our server she really bought our experience really high. Attentive, quick and kind. We had boxes ready for us when we done along with to-go drinks for the road. Every single person working was great, I see why this place is THE BEST SOUL FOOD in Vegas. Great food greater customer service, will be back with more people for sure.

-Dk_tsqukDKPMSnXowt6dA.text: Went there last night tables, dirty 2 people working front 2 cooking ,horrible customer service sat there 15 minIt's a and left they need to close that place

HNxFsF3gyG4dVXZrCHr97w.text: First time dining here (for lunch) and everything from service, food and music was perfect.   My fiance and I had pork chops, red snapper, mac & cheese, dressing and red beans and rice. Their gravy is to die for and they have several gravy options to choose from.  Food was served within 15 minutes which is a major plus for soul food.  This is definitely a place that we plan to visit often and when family/friends are in town.

e8xnZGaZxH8TTZ58YiN-xA.text: The food was very authentic.  The greens and the fried chicken was the highlight of my meal. I will definitely come back soon.

WXP-tM3166KOSL4U9gz6gA.text: My fiance and I had a heavy craving for soul food and decided to try something closer to home rather than our usual spot.   We got there around 1:00pm give or take 5 minutes. We waited about 15 minutes since tables had to be cleaned. Which was no big deal, Sunday lunch rush I'm assuming. We got to choose where to sit which was great.   I loved the wall decore. It was very family-oriented and had an old school vibe with good culture behind each picture. But it got old after about an hour of staring, waiting for our food.   I ordered waffle and wings, the fiance ordered the fried smothered chicken, with chicken gravey, potatoes, and mac.  So an hour in for my chicken and wings and his smothered chicken. Started to get a little sour when other tables were getting their food at a faster rate, but I don't know their orders or wait time. There was a large party of 10 in also, which likely had an impact as well. So that's fine, as long as the food is good. Ya know, worth the wait.   Unfortunately it was dry. The waffle was amazing though! But the chicken was lackluster and appeared to be overcooked in the fryer. This occurred on both our plates. Although crispy and seasoned well, it needed a lot of gravy and syrup. The egg on the side was overdone also. I ordered sunny side, got something that was viaually akin to over easy, and ended up with no yolk.  The gravy was great and the sweet tea was good. My fiance enjoyed the mac. The corn bread was the absolute BEST part of our meal. Soft, moist, flavorful; everything it should be.   Another plus is that the waitress was wonderful. I have a feeling she felt bad for the wait since she kept refilling our drinks to the 9s and did her best to make sure we were taken care of. Good service on her end!   Overall, not impressed by the food, upset that I waited for an hour and fifteen, and hoping to one day give this place another chance if possible, if only for the for  bread.  I would have loved to try the sweet potato pie, and my fiance would have ordered another mac, but we didn't want to sit for another half hour of our only day off.

nwu1mom8e4Iy58I8f64Smg.text: This place is a hidden gem. My wife and I had the catfish, oxtails, and various sides. Everything was PHENOMENAL! The staff was courteous and I never had to ask for a refill on our drinks. They are truly on top of their game!

Pfszd9wX7oNn2Cu8i7YU6A.text: Done! This is the last time I will give my money to this restaurant. I had left this place alone a few years ago after there and the kitchen exploded! I have eaten maybe once or twice in last 3 years, but after today....no more! I paid $57 for three pretty shiity meals. They have gone up on their prices ridiculously. Not worth the money at all. So sad when we try to get over on our own.

9TbOrEQWAmyMK5FWUxWGgw.text: The 1st time that I visited this restaurant I thought that the food was a bit underseasoned but it was delicious the next day. They are one of the only restaurants that has oxtails so I have visited twice since then. The 2nd time the food was delicious. The 3rd time they didn't have oxtails ready and it would be over a 1 hour wait. When trying to order sides the waitress had to ask if they had certian sides available for the day. I think that they have great potential but as a business owner my advise would be to have the cooks come in a little bit earlier so that the full menu is available when they open for the day. I intended to order food for my whole family but they didn't want to have to wait. Unfortunately, they missed out on at least a couple of hundred dollars for that day.

csuh8oydBZR40f28sbccOg.text: This is my go to place for smothered chicken! Its well seasoned and delicious! I like white meat chicken and its never dry to me. You can also get the fried chicken smothered too. Hard to choose between the two.  My husband loves their oxtails. My favorite sides are cabbage, yams, rice with gravy. This place is always busy. They only take credit card orders over the phone. No cash orders. They used too, but stopped. Not sure why.  Either way, check them out. Good food!

vNfu4eLDEHI-LsMsxU_EyQ.text: This has to be one of the worst experiences ever with a restaurant. First, I called the establishment to place a order and was put on hold so long I had to hang up...twice.  After trying a third time I was able to actually place my order but unfortunately was told the item I wanted wasn't available. Switching my order , I was told 15-20 minutes and my food would be ready. Arriving at the location I found myself puzzled on why I had been left on hold that long twice yet only one person was in the dining area eating... While waiting I noticed the customer before me ordered what I previously had my mind set on yet was told it was unavailable,after questioning the cashier/host jokingly she responded saying the customer before me got the last order... Back to waiting, noticing no sense of urgency from the staff as you could tell they rather be elsewhere. You could hear the cooking staff arguing in the kitchen,after about a hour I received my food that looked like crap. 32$ for 2 waffles,3 pieces of over cooked baby chicken wings and a egg that should've been scrambled but was obviously hard boiled and smashed up. If this is indeed a family business that had been around for generations,the founder of this business would be turning in her grave if she were to witness the way her business is being ran.

jU49CbCmUyXagdmYmyonfQ.text: My second time visiting this place and again, a great experience. Very nice small place located in a strip mall in North Las Vegas. Somewhat unassuming and far from a 'hole in the wall'.   I stopped in for lunch with a couple of coworkers who told me to yelp us a place. The service was awesome just like it was last time. The food is made to order so it comes out absolutely piping hot. With that said, you will wait a few extra minutes for the freshness.   The service was great. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. We went in after the lunch hours so it was not very busy. They have about a dozen different lunch specials right at $10 or so.   I went with the fried chicken and it was very good. If I'm being completely honest, not the best fried chicken I've ever tasted but it was still very very good. And it being so fresh is a definite added bonus. The candied yams are phenomenal. The yams are few in number so I was glad it had 2 sides. I also got the collard greens and they were very tasty.  They give you a complimentary piece of cornbread as an appetizer and it's super tasty as well.   If you haven't been- go here. It's voted the best soul food in the valley and you'll see why.

NAWjLjM731dgzBqjDZ4y6Q.text: This was our first time here and "Jaz" treated us like family. We already knew what we wanted to order so we placed our order. The food came out hot and delicious! Everyone at the table absolutely LOVED their food. We had the meatloaf, chicken and waffles, red snapper and a sample of the sides. It all tasted like grandma's home cooking! We will definitely be coming back.  Our sons loved the red Kool Aide, I had the sweet tea and our daughter had the lemonade. All the drinks were good. We also ordered a whole sweet potato pie for Thanksgiving. If you haven't been here you need to come. If we lived here I'd be here frequently.  Thank you Jaz for the wonderful customer service and for the love. Thank you chefs for the amazing food!

The service was also pretty good the young lady had a great attitude and gave great customer service. I have No complaints I would visit again.

sE-oMgBhVuLtAVtXqToD-Q.text: When we want some down home cooked southern meals....this is the only spot we go to.  I hghly recommend the oxtails and mac and chhese!!!

byGY-rM2TqGKWGQb1Kn2SA.text: I'd like to start by saying the food is absolutely AMAZING. I dined with three other people and we all ordered a different dish. Satisfaction overload!!! We were all very pleased and the service was excellent! Las Vegas isn't know for having the best soul food restaurant but this cozy and quaint restaurant has changed that prospective for me! The waitress was very attentive to our needs and made us feel right at home. I must say I'm no easy customer to please so when I say, I've had great service, the average person would consider it the BEST service. I will warn you a place this small with food that amazing gets a little hectic on a Sunday afternoon so I'd try dining there on the weekdays as I've made a few failed Sunday attempts.

7d0SEC6lLNooF8MovWqUaA.text: EllaEm's popped my soul food cherry, and since I have absolutely nothing to compare it to (besides the chicken and waffles at Roscoe's), I'm gonna say that this place is freaking delicious.   I ordered the fried catfish. It comes with any 3 sides of your choice. I originally chose the Mac & cheese, potato salad, and mashed potatoes with beef gravy, but our waitress said they were out of potato salad at the moment so I settled for the candied yams instead. My boyfriend ordered the Wingettes & Waffles, which is just chicken wings and a waffle.   The fried catfish was cooked great. It wasn't too oily at all. The Mac and cheese tasted no different from any other Mac and cheese but the mashed potatoes and candied yams were probably the best I ever had, and I don't even like yams lol. The portions of both the catfish and the sides were huge. So big that there was no way I could've finished it all no matter how hard I was trying. My boyfriend's chicken and waffles were also delicious. The waffle was kinda thin but it was still really flavorful to me. I didn't try the fried chicken wings by itself but the way they cook their chicken and their homemade waffle recipe made for a perfect combination.   About 15 minutes after we started eating, our waitress came back to our table with a side of potato salad for me, on the house, because she felt bad that they didn't have any when she took my order. So that was really nice. The potato salad was just okay though /: I actually felt kinda bad that I didn't like it more than I did since she was giving it to me for free and all lol.  I'd rate their service a 4.9 out of 5 though. Only because when we first walked in we were instantly confused. We weren't greeted at the door by a hostess or anything so we weren't sure if we were supposed to go up to the counter and order or wait to be seated or seat ourselves. (FYI you seat yourselves) Out waitress was really nice. She took care of us; never let our cups go empty, checked up on us an appropriate amount of times, made us feel comfortable and at home, and she even complimented me on my eyes lol. (I gave her an extra couple dollars for her tip for that one haha) By reading the reviews, I noticed a lot of people complaining about how "slow" their service is. I am wholeheartedly disagreeing with that. Yeah, they're not fast food restaurant speedy, but for the fact that they're actually COOKING their food made to order and for how much food they put on the plate, their service is undeserving of being called slow. But that's just my opinion.  All in all, very good. And I will definitely be going back again... and again and again and again lol.

-Ae787AvAg7inAcNELb0DA.text: Yum yum YUM!!!!! My top soul food restaurant by far!  It's hard to find good catfish in Vegas, but theirs is always fresh tasting, cooked perfectly, and just down right delicious!   I will admit that's sometimes the sides aren't consistent, but I've had more good days than bad.   Mac n cheese, yams, greens, and red beans n rice are my top picks!   Definitely worth a visit!!!

QthgyG9QzYv1BjmJzwze5g.text: First off, I am one picky SOB and do not take my soul food lightly. I was skeptical of Ella Ems like I am of all restaurants.  Since this was my first visit I asked the woman behind the counter what she recommended. I went with her recommendation and ordered the ox tails with collard greens, red beans and rice wth gravy.  I ordered my food to go because I left my boxer out of his crate and don't know if he will destroy anything.  Let me tell you every dish was seasoned and cooked to perfection. Beans, greens, oxtails and rice. The gravy was also delicious. The only thing I did not care for was the cornbread muffin. It is too sweet for my liking, it is closer to cornbread cake. If the cornbread was more savory I would have given 5 stars.   The staff yet needs to be evaluated from a dine in standpoint and I will do that on my next visit. Yes I will be back. This establishment is definitely worth visiting. What are you waiting for, go!  And now, the idis.....

j04pavmt47EucspoTqzRSQ.text: We wanted our soul food fix so this was where we stopped (after Mario's didn't have fish steaks).  You can see right into their kitchen and I saw a Hispanic making the food so l was skeptical of what the food would taste like.  I was quickly disappointed as I found out their sweet tea wasn't home made.  I mean how can you have a "soul food" establishment without home brewed sweet ice tea???  Moving on, I got the ox tails with the sides of collard greens, Mac & cheese, rice w/gravy and corn bread muffin.  The ox tail and rice w/gravy was my favorite part of the meal.  The tender meat was falling off the bone with soft rice covered with homemade gravy (9.5/10).  The collards greens were ok.  I personally like my greens cooked a little longer (8/10).  I wasn't a big fan of their mac & cheese but then I'm picky about my mac & cheese.  I'm sure someone likes it that way (7/10). The cornbread tasted more like a cupcake than it did cornbread.  I think they used more flour than cornmeal in their mix.  My friend loved it since he likes cakes (7/10).  Would I come back?  Yes.

xRBhqVRS4zJkwt8AZlYutQ.text: Terrible service. We were recommended this spot by a friend so we gave it a shot after a long day of apartment hunting. We walked in and immediately got a good vibe from this place. Good music playing, food smelled delicious, & we were the only other couple in the restaurant waiting for our food. Unfortunately we waited 1 hour 20 mins until we called it quits! Yes, over a hour! We were too busy looking at the houses &a apartments we saved on our phone to even notice we were waiting that long. The restaurant then had a little crowd and people started getting their food before us. And trust, we played out every explanation...there was no excuse for that terrible service. Things happen, I know...but at LEAST come to our table and let us know what the hold up is. So disappointed. I lowkey think they had a problem with us but I'm not going to get into that! Idk maybe they didn't, but you see, their service was so bad it's got me making up reasons in my head lol I mean there is no other explanation for their trash service. We walked out. I've been working on my temper too so I didn't make a scene. I told my friend about their trash service and he then replied " oh yeah, they are hella slow man. I forgot to tell you that." Lol Order ahead if you dare to go to this place. We'll find another soul food spot though. MF got me hot!!!!

9amH7dXremVojZ_sn9uH7g.text: I have been to this restaurant plenty of times and I have never been disappointed. It has an intimate coffee shop vibe to it. It's a great place for a date, lunch with friends, family or co-workers. Normally spend time gossiping over a plate of authentic soul food. The cornbread here is buttery, fresh and baked to perfection. I can never get  enough of that. The entree comes with 2-3 sides which are plentiful.  They do not take long making your food at all. It's a very homestyle feel. The customer service is perfect. They aren't over bubbly, in your face or checking on you too much.   Ella Em's is outstanding! 5/5

kKcrooOlSxnH_vT--3M0Qw.text: I'm not very picky when it comes to food. I like to help out local businesses instead of the chain restaurants that have a a rep for using frozen foods and microwaves.   But in this instance I should have gone to KFC or Popeyes.  I called and placed a To-Go order for a fried chicken dinner.  I was told about 10-15 minute pick up time. It was closer to 35 minutes.  I asked for cup of water when I arrived and payed for my order.  I had to ask for it 2 more times before I got it. They weren't very busy. I had read other reviews that said service was lacking, so I kind of expected it.  Finally I got my food.  It smelled delicious.  My  drive home seemed eternal.  I got home opened my Styrofoam plates only to find that they had put the gravy on top of my 2 pieces of chicken, i had asked for it on the side.   Oh well, i thought, it could be worse.  And then it was. The gravy was incredibly salty.  My sides were bland.  And then I realized they forgot my peach cobbler. I called and they said I could go by and pick it up because they would not refund my $7.  At that point I should have left mediocre-enough alone. I picked up the medium cobbler. It turned out to be 2 small containers w canned peaches in lots of nectar and some soggy crust.  McDonald's apple pies would have been a better choice.  I spent almost $40 on this meal.  I am very disappointed and will not be returning.

qGojfRkKOSCfse4ANLuHgw.text: A solid offering in the Soul Food/Southern category. The food is good. Admittedly, I have had better fried chicken elsewhere, but EllaEm's does it justice. Also tried the fried fish - great!  Not too greasy.  Southern food wouldn't be complete without sides, and here, EllaEm's also shines. Collard greens, mac and cheese, red beans, black eyed peas - all excellent! IMO, the standout was the yams.    I didn't have a problem with the service here, unlike others' experience.  It was a bit on the slow side - so not good if you're in a time crunch. However, the staff are friendly.  I think this is a family business, which I'm always fond of supporting whenever possible.  Decor is casual, and the price isn't too bad (especially for Vegas standards).

Hnu9gMm35RmP6PwJMPGYfg.text: This is probably my favorite Soul food restaurant in Vegas. I've had a number of items on the menu and they have all been very flavorful and tasty.

sLf6wQO2oeJlYzpFsHN4Yw.text: I was in town visiting and decided to stop in and give the restaurant a try based off of my friends experience and the reviews that I read. The food was PHENOMENAL!! I enjoyed the flavors and could taste the soul in every item that I ordered. The service from Jas was beyond superb!!!! She made sure our drinks were always filled and her kind customer service made us return again to have a wonderful experience. Jas went above and beyond to make sure we had endless FRESH cornbread while we waited for our food and gave us a fresh batch for the road. I highly recommend asking for Jas as your server to have a wonderful experience like we did.

w4-6W_6xrQcRfIVqFmDMtA.text: So I've tried this place before when visiting about two years ago. The fact that I could vaguely remember my meal should have been a red flag! I LOVE well made soul food, this was lackluster at best.I'll start with the rice since it aggravated me the MOST because how do you fudge up plain white rice? It was so mushy and gummy  also the gravy needs so umph! The Oxtails were decent nice size no complaints there however I'm an oxtails rice and gravy tour of gal so the rice kind of fucked up the meal for me.  The Mac n cheese was boo boo it taste like had been sitting in a refrigerator for quite a while! Also it seems as though they use those deluxe box pasta GROSS. Please don't pass the garbage sprinkled with cheddar cheese as southern Mac! Last Item was the yams all I have is an eh for those. I'm writing this review to remind myself never to try this place again!

4VE0pL-zs8hnKqSqzv9IdA.text: *sigh* I am not the one to write bad reviews, but I had to say something about an individual that works here. When we sat down a young man came to our table and didn't really greet us and asked for our drink order. I asked for a unsweetened tea and my boyfriend asked for a sweet tea-we got 2 sweet teas. Then he acted as if he were bothered that he had to get me an unsweetened tea. Then I noticed how much energy/enthusiasm as he was serving two young BLACK females. Very complimentary towards them even calling them his "beautiful Nubian queens" aha, I got it now. He was treating us poorly because we are an interracial couple. I guess I wasn't "black enough" for his liking.   I saw other ppl got cornbread while they were waiting for their meal and checked on-not us. I even saw him clock out and leave and didn't even bother to tell us that someone else was going to take over and that he was leaving. After waiting for a while another server saw we were waiting and introduced herself, got us cornbread and was shocked that no one offered that to us while we waited. She was nice and made up for the initial experience. I appreciate her efforts. The food was good (I prefer the Soul Food cafe).   But I am SO disappointed that people are so bothered by who I love. And that you are so bothered that you would go to such great lengths to make me feel so uncomfortable. I feel sorry for you. I feel sorry that you are so small minded. I feel sorry that you will never experience life outside of north Las Vegas. I feel sorry that my happiness makes you so uncomfortable. Most of all I feel sorry for anyone else you come in contact with at that restaurant that you don't seem worthy of your service-which you are getting paid to do-as they won't patronize an establishment due to your lack of intelligence.

EgZ7lBqnqEzBcEmTD6TOcQ.text: Some of the best soul food I've ever had! The. Catfish was seasoned so well and the fries were just right. The homemade lemonade had too much sugar for me but everything else was great!

pGwfHMWE2-EZl4w7holYaQ.text: I have visited twice. The first time, a young woman took my order. When that order came out I informed the young man (with his pants sagging) that they must have forgotten that the order came with three wings. The man sighed and chuckled as if I was wrong. I grabbed a menu off another table and informed the young man to which he apologized and quickly rectified the situation. The second time I visited with a friend. After about a 30 minute wait, other people who came in after I did received their meals. The young lady informed me that my meal was coming up. I would have believed her if it was not for the fact that individuals who came in after me was receiving their orders. Finally, another lady tells me the truth. She informed me that my ticket was lost, to which I replied that I was leaving (I'm out). The owner (watching the situation) sprang into action and resolved the situation. I would normally rate an establishment like this a negative star rating (if I could) based solely off of customer service; however, I believe with a well trained staff EllaEm's cannot only become a world class establishment, but also expand beyond the Las Vegas metro area. Lastly, despite the bad service the food is excellent; however, great food does not constitute customer loyalty.  MDE

7-M6ygfCIqQsnZe5N7LraA.text: Southern food is an art. I use the term southern, whereas EllaEm's and many of the cafes of this type in town use Soul Food. I believe they are synonymous as both southern and soul food share almost all aspects. They most unifying similarity is they are both born out of poverty, and this is what makes southern/soul food an art. It is easy to make a fantastic meal when you have the finest cuts of meat and important spices with which to flavor the food. However, when you have to create magic from the poorest cuts of meat, vegetables that are easy to grow and considered common, and your spice palate consist of little more than salt, pepper and broth that is the example of a True artist. It is easy to paint when you have all the paints and a fine canvas, but to create something out of nothing with almost nothing shows real talent.   EllaEm's is artistry on display. It is fine southern food with flavor to spare. This is not a diet conscious restaurant where calories can be counted. It is instead a representation of a culture where food is used as an offering of love, and often the best of times happen around a dinner table. There is little pomp, and no circumstances here, just good food at a reasonable price...well mostly reasonable.   On my first visit I had the fried chicken (dark meat), fried cabbage, red beans and rice, mashed potatoes and gravy, and two corn muffins (my heart will never forgive me). The chicken was excellent, very moist and fresh with a good crispy crust. My one of only two complaints from the evening was there were only two pieces of dark meat chicken. The sides made it more than enough for a fulfilling meal, but one more piece of chicken would have made me feel better about the order. The red beans and rice were good, but not great. The mashed potatoes with chicken gravy were to die for. I must return to have the chicken and waffles with chicken gravy (for which my heart will once again curse me). I had the fried cabbage at the suggestion of my friendly and courteous, albeit somewhat slow, server (second small complaint) . The cabbage was perhaps the best part of the meal, and would win hands down if not for the corn muffin. Go ahead and order two at the start because one is just not going to cut it.   I would like to give EllaEm's 4.5 stars because of the two small discrepancies I mentioned above. I rounded up instead of down because ElleEm's is exactly the type of business I, and I hope you, like to support. It is local owned, not in a fancy location, and providing a good service at a reasonable price. I big you if you are wanting a good meal with a distinct American cultural edge, chose ElleEm's over any one of the worthless and "soulless" chain restaurants which litter our city. It adds wonderfully to the burgeoning community Vegas has so long needed.

0AHYNZeAM5GiEOxEJ6-FuQ.text: We had a late lunch here a few weeks ago and it blew us away! So good. Friendly staff and great food. Much better than M&M Soul Food. Better prices and better tasting food.  I don't need to have the staff at a soul food restaurant serve me wearing tuxedo shirts and bowties like they do at M&M.   We will return often to EllaEm's!

Cej6dJoQX9lav44qCNhLmQ.text: A 'must go' everytime I come to Vegas.  Had the chicken n waffles this time, A+ all around.  I've never had anything I didn't like there.  And they play good eatin' music!

dmkHMgeRec3SK8NnVo4yKw.text: I went for lunch on Thursday afternoon and the place was packed! Great sign, usually, so my giddiness continued as I waited for my friend and hungrily watched other patrons place their orders and receive their lunches. The place is cute, clean, and comfortable. There were two large parties (one leaving, one ordering) when I came in. All in all a good vibe, good music in the background that still allowed for conversation, and smiles abound. I was excited!  It pretty much ended there. I really, really, really wanted to like this place. I would have preferred to have loved this place, but I would have settled for an "I love you, but not in THAT way" sort of conversation here.   Alas, I am not sure I want a second date.  First: The service was VERY slow. Yes, it's a small place. And mostly it was service with a smile. But it was slow. We all but flagged the waiter down to order our drinks. And then again to order lunch. He kept pointing out how slammed they were. I could see it, I sort of get it, but then there should be more help on the floor. He was genuinely kind and happy to help us, but it doesn't make up for the fact that once both of us were seated, it took 15 minutes-plus to finally let them know what we wanted to eat. Add to that the wait for the food itself? My hour lunch was approaching an hour and I hadn't had anything to eat yet.  Never got a drink refill. Had to ask for silverware. Getting the to-go boxes (I took those greens to go!) and the checks was OK, but then had to wait for the payments to be processed while watching the waiter do other things.  OK, OK, there were SOME good points.  Here we go... food. I decided to try the liver and onions. You get to choose three (huge portions here!) sides. I went with mac and cheese, collard greens, and fried cabbage. (Oy, I did not come here expecting to adhere to any diet, that's for sure!)  The large portion of liver was cooked perfectly but the cut was off. Too much connective tissue running through it. I'd rather smaller pieces cut away from the parts you can't chew/eat. It had a hint of a breading/coating on it that was not bad, not over the top. But I had a small bit where it was all flour. No bueno.  The collard greens were the best ever. Seriously. Eat them. (Insert "Eat All The Greens! meme here.)  The mac was good, definitely homemade. I only tasted it because pasta is not my friend, but the flavors and composition were really decent. Not amazing, but decent.  The cabbage was, against all odds, really great. Too oily/buttery for MY tastes, but still managing not to be wilted and brown; it was bright, a tad crisp. Surprisingly good but slightly over on the grease scale for MY tastes (trying to be fair... it is, after all, "fried cabbage!").  S's massive portion of meatloaf with rice with gravy were good, she said, though the yams were a tad on the raw side. She also had the mac and agreed: good, yes, tasty, but nothing to write home about. (To go box for the food here, too, so that says a little something.)  Another thing I didn't love? The photos on the menu didn't seem to totally match the food. Not just like, "hey, mine doesn't look like that," but in a "they don't even offer that on their menu!" sort of way. I felt cheated that I couldn't order cole slaw or green beans, even though they were so prominently displayed.  Huge portions of mostly OK-ish food. Smiley but slooooow service. Prices are fine based on portions, but when it's just OK? *sigh*   Just not excited about a return trip.

s6nVW5M_8CLl639FHTalcA.text: Nice decor & ambiance for a strip-mall restaurant, very surprising and welcome.  We were there on a quiet afternoon and were amazed at how fantastic the food is and the service was just incredible.  One of the gals there saw me picking food off my husband's plate and brought me a serving of the same thing, gratis.    My southern hubby had the catfish plate and loved it, and we both loved the fried cabbage.  Not a southerner, I tried their cheeseburger - it was okay but there's a reason why this isn't a burger joint ;)  Next time (and there will definitely be a next time) I'll break down and try to deal with the southern obsession with frying everything ;)

1oX58vVg8QNSi2fseJ7tqA.text: Visited the restaurant for lunch w/the worst customer service ever.  Felt like we were ignored b/c we were the only non-black people there.  An older waitress totally ignored us for almost 20 minutes.   My wife & I took our daughter for the catfish & fried chicken that we always order.  The waitress went to every other table in the restaurant to check up & even cleared a table w/the dirty plates left from  previous customers directly across from us.  We told her we were ready to order & were ignored.  Then, another african american 3 top sat down & were immediately greeted w/a drink order & silverware.  We were never asked for drinks or greeted.  I work in the beverage industry at a major casino on the strip & would consider our experience a 1-10 score.  The waitress never acknowledged us & we will never dine there again in person.   Maybe order via phone & p/up so we won't have to remember this experience.  Sorry for the bad rating but a simple "Hi, I'll be right with you & or What can I  get you to drink."   Would've made a big difference.  So, we went to the Poke Express & other local Asian restaurant & had a great lunch.  I don't think Ms. Ella would be proud of her horrible waitress that works Saturday days.

BaMe5g_aWe7dKeRn-EcebQ.text: I had a great meal at EllaEms today.  The fried chicken with gravy on the side, mac & cheese, collard greens, and cornbread were all delicious. My waitress (I can't remember her name) was awesome. She kept the refills coming she made sure that we were well taken care of and she was very friendly and courteous.

UnKnZvfriyg2nA_WehYkJw.text: Best soul food in Vegas by far!!! Great service!! Thanks Alyson and Q! I enjoyed the Ox tails and baby back ribs. Boom!!

uCcwRhjPV6dIfxqFnBhs2w.text: If you want quality, great tasting food without busting your wallet while enjoying a great atmosphere this is the place to go. The ambience of this restaurant is wonderful. The first time I went there it felt like a family dinner after church. Normally they play classic And modern RnB music.The Catfish, and fried chicken are my favorite foods. This store gives a True taste of southern style food. I have brought many family and friends who visit from the east coast and they all are very pleased with the meal. The customer service is also great and I have never had any issues with this restaurant. They have many other great tasting food on there menus like oxtail, cornbread, and collard greens to name a few. Also there entrees come with three sides unlike most other restaurants that only come with two. The restaurant is a great way to spend a family dinner or a simple date.

VhOnNp5TIepg4KQ7Xt-pyQ.text: Visiting from California and had a craving for some soul food. Yelped my options and decided on this one. Best choice ever!!! Service was impeccable and everything I mean everything was just delectable. Not overly greasy or heavy but still packed with loads of flavor. This place will be an absolute go to every time I come to Vegas. Shout out to Q our server. :)

XPzUvFIkuFiXRDc_phswEg.text: There aren't very many places to get soul food in Vegas, so this was a pleasant surprise. It appears to be a family run restaurant and there's not too many staff members here. There was one waitress/hostess here when I came for lunch, so the service was a little slow but expected.   I got the $7 lunch special that comes with an entree choice, two sides, and cornbread. I had the fried chicken, which was decent but not great. I had a drumstick that was cooked to perfection, but a breast piece that was overly salty. Not sure why that was. I also got a chance to try the catfish that my coworker ordered and I would get that if I were to come back. Perfectly crisp and flavorful.  Among the sides I tried, the cabbage and yams were good, while the mac and cheese and collared green were just alright.  The cornbread was very moist with good texture as well.  If there were a 0.5 star rating, I would probably give EllaEm's a 3.5 overall. There are hits or misses on the menu. Also, some extra staff members to help with the service would be beneficial.

nYk83vISy0qNnSLMRDHNmw.text: We had a great meal here. LOVED the fried chicken ( dark meat although you can get breast meat if you prefer), fried fish, and ribs. Collard green were tasty, Mac and cheese a bit bland, yams were yummy (a little sweet for me but others liked them). Service was terrific and super nice. The only disappointment was the peach cobbler made with canned peaches and it had a soggy underdone crust. No need for dessert anyway because portions are generous. Give this place a try.

d9MSJOv_B-_WUd2olVOUiQ.text: I am a white girl from Chicago. I don't know much about soul food but i do know BAR-B-Q!  EllaEm's has the BEST baby back ribs I've ever had (in Las Vegas.) I am surprised at some of the negative reviews here on Yelp, but thats what review are all about.  Yes, it is hidden away in strip mall on Craig road between a Hawaiian Plate joint and a Teriyaki Madness chain. I decided to give it a try. I AM GLAD I DID!!     We ordered take out because it was the day of the Emmy Awards. We wanted to eat and relax at home. We ordered the Baby Back ribs, collard greens, fried cabbage, yams and sweet potato pie for dessert. ALL ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!  the girls behind the counter were very personal and the place was immaculately clean and inviting.   People!!! Don't be so picky, this is Las Vegas!  Sure, there are better places to eat.  However, i will definitely keep this on my TOP TEN places  to get GREAT BBQ in NORTH Las Vegas!!!

K_z6Y7TKbBHfJ7Utfm1DBQ.text: GREAT SERVICE!!! Ox tales are delicious!! Great portions.  Very pleasant visit I recommend this restaurant.

Mv3sLSG1BsBZWWE6LStTYg.text: I don't have an issue with the food. I do have an issue with no one ever answering the phone. I feel that it would be faster to make my order over the phone and pick it up. This place would be so much better if they had more help. It's pointless to call because no one answers and the service is ridiculously slow when you go in. One guy was running around there doing everything and he had two other girls there with him. They seemed like they didn't have a clue.

9EB0iA7LE7frDA5RAMEOMA.text: I recently came here for lunch with some coworkers. I was a bit worried there wouldn't be a table for us since it was a Friday around noon, but luckily we were able to get a table for 6 right away. The interior is very blues/jazzy feeling and it's located in a strip mall near Poke Express.   They had multiple different options available for their lunch specials. I opted for the Red Snapper with my sides being Fried Okra and Yams. The food is cooked fresh once you order which is always a wonderful touch. The portion sizes are also HUGE. My meal came with about 2-3 filets of fish and two soup sized bowls of sides. I really liked how the fish tasted and was cooked, but wish there was some type of spiced tartare sauce to go with it. The fried okra was very good, the breading wasn't overwhelming and it wasn't too salty. I really liked the yams. They had a type of sweet glaze on them which was very good.  I was very happy with this place. A nice little homey, southern fine in North Las Vegas.

ejqMm7TJLenrIoPKHQvJVg.text: Decided to visit EllaEm's this afternoon after learning that the place I wanted to visit was closed until Thursday. This was my third visit to the restaurant.  Their Lunch specials, starting at just over $12, are great value for the dollar. I had their smothered chicken, yams, Mac and cheese and rice and gravy. The portions were good but my yams were cold. I mentioned it to the staff and I was promptly brought out a replacement order; maybe heated and returned but it was right the second time.  I wasn't a fan of their Mac and cheese but everything else was pretty good.  I may not rush back to EllaEm's but they earned repeat business. I love patronizing small, single location, mom and pop businesses. That is what keeps our city going.

xmjHGCTYoWLdrVOv-xkPJQ.text: This was the worst customer service I have ever experienced. Everyone in our party got all their food except for my friend because they got her order wrong. She didn't get her meal until we where boxing up our left overs and before she even got her food the owner of the restaurant put our bill on the table. I then asked the waitress if she can do something about her meal so she went to the owner and the owner offered 10% off her meal alone lol our bill was $93 and the meal was 16.99 so she offered to take $1.69 off the whole bill or she can take the food back lol I advised I wasn't paying for the meal so she took it back to the kitchen then came to our table and started arguing in front of the customers about how she would've just took the discount and she can't give food for free. It should've been a compensation for the mess up. I'm almost sure the pork chops they tried to bring out first that the waitress accidentally rang in was given to the table next to us. We will never go back

CNwBTjQs6qy13edzEOJ_eA.text: They were sooooooooooo close to a 5. Dammit I wanted them to be a 5, since the last soul food joint here was a total disappointment. UGH!!!!   Anywho, my food was GOOD!!! I initially was going to take out, then decided to dine in. I came in for lunch and they were busy. They only have about 8 four seat tables, but they utilize them all. I can see this place having a serious crowd on wknds and especially after church on Sundays. Their call-ins were jumping too. I wanted fish & chicken so the waitress suggested to do the fish lunch for $10.99, it comes w/2 sides and add the 2 fried thighs I wanted. Which is what I did.   A cornbread muffin came out 1st w/butter. Then my lunch came 10mins later. PIPING HOT!!!! I ate the fish 1st. TO DIE FOR!!! This was some seriously tasty fresh catfish filets. No swai crap served here! Greens weren't out of a can, I did add hot sauce they were a little bland. Then I tasted my chicken, it was good, but not fried hard enough because the meat was still a little rubbery, but had it not been for that they'd have gotten 5*s. Chicken was fresh & hot, good seasoning no salt needed, just wasnt fried long enough. Finally I tasted my yams. Yummy!!! Just the right sweetness to them. This was a solid lunch for 10.99, even though I added on the chicken being greedy!   Let's talk about the service. This 1 young lady ran the joint almost alone. She never folded under the pressure either. Phones jumping, waiting area filled. She served us hunni! I can appreciate her. She did it all with a pleasant tone and a smile. I will be back!

ojx8ejoTwIgJGenxhxxKYQ.text: Great food, best soul food in NEVADA PERIOD. And I'm from the Bay Area, so no joke.  I gave them a three star because of service. I highly suggest the Oxtails and smothered chicken with beef gravy not chicken gravy, and you cannot miss their fried cabbage .   Thank you EllaEm's!! My Bay Area fam loves you! #soulfood #EllaEm's #41510

The Mac and cheese was bland , the oxtails needed to be cooked a lil longer . They yams has to much syrup, the greens didn't have enough seasoning , the corn cakes was gummie & the dressing ? JrGQ8X3rDDUzJ44KDUDahA.text: It has been a year since I've been to Ella Ems and decided to go with family this past Sunday. I was really disappointed with our entire experience. The staff in the past gave a southern hospitality feel, which is no longer the experience. The staff yesterday just seemed confused and frustrated with each other.  From the time we sat down until we received our food was nearly a hour. My cousin ordered catfish which was brought out with the wrong sides so instead of changing the sides we watched the server take the plate to another table. After another 10 minutes we asked about her food and the server said they ran out of fish and they were going to the store to get more fish and acted like it was okay for us to wait. I could go on and about our negative experience. Something has changed about this place cause everything has went down hill from the service to the food.

The fish wasn't seasoned at all and was soggy not crunchy like it had been made yesterday. The yams tasted old & had a strange taste to them & the Mac and cheese was decent, it just needed to be cooked a little longer. Even the cornbread was a disappointment. 6sppw9SiU6qHocNAJ4VUEw.text: The food here is very good but the service is lacking. I have been many times and the quality is consistent. However, I went today in a group of 9 people. We all waited for quite a while for our food. Eight of the meals came out slowly, one by one, as I sat there with no food at all. Eventually the waitress checked on me while the rest of the group was finishing their meals. She discovered that the cook missed my order by mistake.  I was the last to get my food.  When I received the bill, the full price of my order was on the check. I inquired about this and the waitress stated that they don't offer any service recovery. No discount, no free dessert, nothing but an I'm sorry. She stated that the manager was not there and that she would unlikely offer anything to make up for the mistake. This is unacceptable customer service. Be aware if you encounter this here.

vveE6MLycniWcx_YuOcVPQ.text: IT'S ALL ABOUT THE CATFISH!  Atmosphere: small, cozy, fun music and conversation just fill this space with a jovial feeling.   Service: cheerful, friendly, and attentive. Forgot my salad until I was already eating my meal. Really should have comped it at that point. I didn't eat it.   Food: FRIED CATFISH! This is what I came for and I was not disappointed. Perhaps the BEST catfish I've ever eaten. I will crave this regularly. The mashed potatoes were just alright, I didn't even eat them. The mac n cheese was very good. I'll be having that again. The salad was forgotten and by the time it arrived I wasn't in the mood but they used what tasted like bottled hidden valley ranch and I really prefer the freshly made stuff. The sweet tea wasn't sweet enough. I know! I was shocked too.   Price: a little high. I wish I could just buy the catfish and none of the sides. But I'll pay it to get that catfish so. ...

GnCQzho9DWu2cjbDQnIrpw.text: Our visit started out with very slow service Once the food arrived we were happy until my son pulled out his mouth a finger of a glove it was in his cabbage  I walked it up to the cashier and handed it to her  she called what seams to be the manager once on the phone they didn't apologize and wanted us to pay for all the food minus the cabbage  When we finally talked to the owner he accused us of trying to get free food instead of are you ok We were on vacation and looked this place up This was a terrible experience for my family

luHDtDb_UpKqu4CJ2oW9fQ.text: Was staying in the area for the Rise festival a d wanted to grab a bite.  Found this on yelp and decided to give it a try.  Very glad we did. A friendly staff greeted us. We had the meatloaf with red sauce and the fried chicken.  The plates come with 3 sides,  we got dressing, greens, sweet potatoes, fried cabbage, mashed potatoes, and potato salad.  The sweet potatoes were the only item that we weren't wowed by. Wil return here next year for sure.

Qm6VQcUGrgWs2WQAACWOrA.text: Experience:  This was bookmarked in my YELP and I was in the area. I convinced my friend to stop in and get Togo.   Facility:  It's a small spot located inside of a strip mall. There were about 10 tables and chairs in the room, and a small ordering counter in the back.   Service:  The young gal at the counter was super friendly and helpful. She helped me make my selections and even brought me my cornbread to the table while I was waiting, so I could take some medication.   I believe it was the owner was at the counter too while I was ordering and she didn't really look my way or act friendly. She seemed like the type that is just so focused on getting the work done, she forgets to stop and smile at the customers. That's fine, as long as she is not rude, and the food is good, I'm not mad at her. LOL!   Food:  The problem with soul food or southern or BBQ joints, is I want to taste every side dish. So I ordered a bunch. LOL!  I got the fried chicken plate with Mac and cheese, greens, fried cabbage, French fries, and red beans. Greedy, huh?? Normally I would order the potato salad, but they let me taste a sample, and it was really sweet and had a distinct flavor I can't place, but is not my style. I like plain old, mayo/mustard/relish/eggs type potato salad. I call it southern style, but not sure the exact name.  The cornbread (4/5) was good, with just a bit of sweetness, which I like.  We ate the French fries (4/5) while we waited for the rest of the food. They were fresh, hot and pretty good.  The chicken 3.5/5 was cooked well, but a tad too salty.  The fried cabbage was my favorite 4/5, but the Mac and cheese 3/5, greens 3/5 and red beans 3/5 were just ok.  A tad bland.  Is it bad to say I like my fried chicken, corn bread, Mac and cheese, and fried cabbage better?!  O.o  Overall: it was good, but M&Ms is closer, so I would probably just go there.  If you're in the neighborhood, you should check it out though.

5cDhLck9rMrQIHH8iKKKkw.text: Very impressed!  My Chicken & Waffles craving led me to a long awaited bookmark, right next door to my favorite Hawaiian spot in town!  Ordered the Wingettes & Waffle (Lunch Special). The chicken was good, crispy and juicy with a very tasty waffle!  Not my favorite chicken in town, but it was done well, and the waffle was great!  Eva had the Fried Pork Chops (Lunch Special). Comes with two sides...we chose Black Eyed Peas and Collard Greens. The pork chops were pretty much PERFECT! Very thin, crispy and tender...so good!  Doesn't get much better than this guys!  On a side note, the Cornbread here is DELICIOUS!  It comes out piping hot with just the right amount of moisture inside....like a great cake.  It doesn't even need BUTTER!    And to finish, we were recommended the Peach Cobbler. This was good as well. I liked the crust/breading here...they make this fresh in-house.  Recommended!

4Hg6V1N1OcJlZJf7XV7vUg.text: This had been maybe my 5th time to EllaEm's thanks to Groupon. I had always had a pleasant experience until last nite. NEVER go at night. The service was HORRIBLE. I wondered were me and my kids invisible?? Well finally another waitress came over Heather to take my order and all. I can say this the other few times i have come to EllaEms it was during the day time so maybe the day shift is friendlier, Ramon is the waiter usually there that i see and he has always given me and my friends good service. -9nKNYifNZ42Jnn6gO96vA.text: I came here with my extended family while we were out in Vegas for a softball tourney. The place was quite, cute and clean. We got seated right away.   Ordered our food. A main dish and 3 sides, I got fried pork chops, greens, mac & cheese and red beans and rice. We had 6 people all together and the food came out quick. I was quite surprised that our food was out already. Everything I had was good. All my sides were good. Oh, yeah and they give you cornbread too. The cornbread was tasty too. I can't even say which side was my favorite, but I will say that the red beans and rice and greens were pretty damn tasty. Our server was friendly and our glasses were never empty.   One thing I will say, is that their desserts, not all since I didn't try them all, but the Red Velvet cake and Lemon cake are not the ones. I think it was a box cake with vanilla frosting, not even the cream cheese frosting for the Red Velvet. Both cakes were a lil on the dry side.   Overall, it was a good experience and I would so go again if I was out wandering in Vegas.

qNqYRHSUJaKonOGrtpJQrQ.text: Great food and attentive staff!  The fried catfish is on point along with the mac and cheese. I thought my mamma was in the kitchen cooking. Ramon was the best with making sure I was satified with service and food.  Everything was awesome.
