Q3viR2ihDsJN-AqD_p5oeA.text: It was the best chicken and waffles ever and the service very friendly. My fiance who ate at  Roscos in La when he lived there said it even beat them for their chicken and waffles . So we recommend it to all our friends who live here and come here to visit.

4_tfUCJUuJXiebM0I_1vrw.text: Ellaem's is outstanding and has geniue Southern Soul Food.  I had the fried chicken with the white meal smoothered in chicken gravy and it was fantastic!  The fried chicken was lightly battered, very moist and tender.  I had the fried cabbage, potato salad and the rice and beans as my sides and the portions were very generous and delicious.    The staff is very helpful and friendly.  Kim was one of our servers and she is outstanding with a very cheerful personality.  I would highly recommend Ellaem's and we are certainly going to be go back on a regular basis.

QDTlqydNwmFNAm3N3CBXjg.text: Soul food--yum!.  I bought a Groupon to this place after having read the Yelp reviews and there's a reason it's so highly rated.  I went with my teenage son and his father for dinner tonight, and when we arrived around 7:00pm, the place had only two other tables occupied.  It's a clean, nicely decorated, small place in a strip mall.  I ordered the oxtail stew and three sides: mac n cheese (eh, I've had better at TC's Rib Crib), mashed potatoes and gravy, and yams.  The latter two side dishes were done well and the oxtails themselves were fabulous!  I couldn't finish my food, so you definitely get your money's worth.  Each entree comes with the three sides, so that could also be why I was in a food coma afterwards.  Before our main dishes arrived, we were each served cornbread, which was heavenly--I wanted more, but didn't ask because I could have gotten full on that alone.  My son and his dad had the fried catfish and they rated it better than Hush Puppy's--the gold standard according to them.  I don't eat fish, but just looking at their food, I could tell it wasn't as greasy as the catfish I've seen at other places.    Service was great, the food is delicious, and the only reason I am not giving it a 5 star rating is that I'm a stickler for good mac n cheese, and theirs was just okay.  So, if you're every hankering for some good Southern cooking, head over to EllaEm's for the kind of food that sticks to your ribs and leaves you feeling satisfied...the guilt sets in much later.

Afou64OM_AcUaqmTT2MCjg.text: It's a good thing that EllaEm's is a thousand miles away. If they were close to me, I'd be 400 pounds in no time!   We were vacationing in Vegas and, being the consummate Queen of Bargains, I had found a Groupon Now for EllaEms. After checking Yelp, I thought it was worth a chance.    My fellow Yelpers did not let me down.  Even though EllaEm's is in a strip  mall, we found it to be comfortable, welcoming and the food was great.  There is a sense of family and tradition.  I like that!  My man-folk had been disappointed that he hadn't had black eyed peas for New Years (not a tradition I was familiar with) so I was happy to tell him about the catfish and selection of sides.    It was out of the way for tourists like us but with GPS, we found our way.  The young man working was attentive and courteous. Between the fried chicken, meatloaf or ribs, I couldn't decide what I wanted. I asked his opinion and said that his fave was the chicken.   I went with the chicken, mashed potatoes and gravy, mac and cheese and potato salad.  The man-folk ordered the catfish, black eyed peas, collard greens and veggies, I think.    Not only was he happy, but I loved my dinner. The chicken was the best I have ever had. The sides were all delicious too.  The cost (even if I didn't have a Groupon) was very reasonable and the sizes were generous.  Vegas is lucky to have EllaEms. I'm going to add them to my list things to do when I return.    Yum!!

2415sinkgoD95qe1L2xy8w.text: Great food. The meat fell right off the bones of my smothered chicken. My dining partner's fried catfish was perfect, both seasoning and texture. They have delicious greens, yams, and red beans as well.  Only problem was the service. It was maybe half full, but the two on staff seemed a little overwhelmed. My hopeful guess is that their experienced wait staff works the busier days.

PDZSTl5V6Qxrc59mWLVLLg.text: Wow, what a pleasant surprise! Originally planned to go to Poke Express next door but totally forgot that they are closed on Wednesday so we decided to visit Ella Em for some soul food grub.   We were warmly greeted at the door by Victor who seated us right away. Entrees were a little bit on the high side ($9-15) yet still not too expensive considering you get 4 large sides including the corn bread. We also learned that lunch specials tend to run between $7-$9 and it comes with 2 sides. They also offer 10% military discount.  We ordered:  Pork chop - This reminds me of how we cook pork chop in the Philippines! Well seasoned and tasty. Rice & gravy - Basic rice here, nothing to write home about. The gravy was nice and and you get to choose between chicken and beef gravy. Both were delicious, but I prefer the beef gravy. I would probably skip this next time and order another side in the future. Collard greens - Not a big fan of collard greens in general but hubby said it was good (But he had better when he was in Mississippi). Fried cabbage - DELICIOUS! Sooo homey and definitely a big hit for both of us and we licked that bowl off for sure! We should have ordered more of these.  Fried chicken (2 pcs) - Juicy and crispy! I love fried chicken cooked this way, lightly battered and seasoned with Granny's special seasoning.  Mashed potatoes - Tastes like how we make it at home. Between my husband and I we could have skipped it but my daughter will probably not like that cause it's her staple. Yams - Soooo good. Sweet with a touch of cinammon! Corn bread - I love their corn bread but it was waaay too tiny. You can order more for 50 cent a piece. Wish they would make it thicker.  All the food that came out were freshly made and the service was friendly, we felt like we're eating home cooked meal on Thanksgiving. The kitchen is super busy with several to-go orders and it was barely 4pm, but we never felt neglected by our server. We will be back to try their catfish, oxtail, and peach cobbler. Was it authentic? I possess no authority whatsoever on southern-style cooking, but my soul was definitely tickled with such a positive dining experience.

PSuDS5uCSxgYEjmYEtS4JQ.text: Ella Ems  is a nice restaurant very clean. I ordered the oxtail with and entree you get three sides. I chose the yams , mash potato's and mac n cheese. , you think i got enough carbs?                The oxtails were excellant meaty ,tender  and moist in a very good brown gravy. Portion size on the oxtails were small , I received 3 med sized pieces. Mash potatos  were solid . Yams were amazing , very flavorful. Some of the best yams ever ate. The mac n cheese on the other hand were very disappointing. No cheese flavor very, very bland. They also serve cornbread which was very good , a little sweet, how us yankee's like it as my mother in law would say. Overall pretty happy with the meal

JgRRiZeoxJw7-JqZkCNJ0g.text: For starters four of us walked in and all four orders were wrong then we get home we check to see the orders and we took a bite out of somebody else's food brought it back to them and they tried to give it to the customer when he showed up if it weren't for the fact that he said I want my food fresh he could have brawl we know gotten age from somebody's food that they got taken out of the store and brought back. Then the attitude that the girl up front and Davis when we asked for you know something and compensation for being screwed over she said that we didn't tip and that's why it was order was screwed up. In all honesty we gave her a cheerleader $6 for $40 ticket I mean she got tipped well so in my opinion what are the worst places in town... I give the food to the service of a half a point and the restaurant cleanliness 1.

a0WP16ENRc_tDDpJkicitg.text: Enjoyed dinner tonight for sure. Catfish and fried cabbage is a must!  Oxtail with rice and gravy was also very good! We will try fried chicken next time. Fast and very friendly staff!

XVc2eVsb1q0wzIGhYH2O4A.text: Very warm welcome when you enter. Food was prepared freshly and delivered in a scrumptious display. Kind of expensive 4 people with regular size dinner meals came up to $90.

t_JcjsEuMXu3SxYejlNPOA.text: This restaurant is worth getting off the strip. The portions are HUGE. My boyfriend had the Catfish dinner with 3 sides of Mac-n-cheese, yams and rice smothered with gravy. I had the catfish sandwich with fries. The catfish is amazing, succulent and spiced just right. (We went to a much more expensive Southern restaurant later in the week and I ordered the catfish which was dryed out!)  The sides including the fries were all wonderful. We will definitely go back later this year when we're in Vegas again.  We're dying for the catfish again and try some new items!  I highly recommend making the 20 minute drive to North Las Vegas to eat here and then hit one of the Station Casinos as well.

UkR--6minPqPQZYK4GsXOg.text: This place is a real gem! I had the catfish, which was a bit too salty, but delicious (hey, it's soul food after all). The cornbread was the best I've ever had.   The service was prompt and very friendly, as was the rest of the crowd. As a transracial family with an adopted son from Haiti, we weren't sure what kind of reception we would receive in a soul food restaurant. It was not an issue. We felt very welcomed, and EllaEm's does a great job of demonstrating pride in their heritage.   It was a great experience overall, and we will definitely be back!

P4DEjqithHCe1v3ZwF7DnA.text: This place is fantastic, the food is delicious and Kim was outstanding in assisting us. We will definitely return for a visit when we're in Las Vegas!!!

OjUqUBmeKy6E2a-I3hZxHQ.text: My Girlfriend and I went in right after church at noon. We sat ourselves. There were only 3 tables occupied. The server came to the table with the telephone to his ear, never greeted us, just laid 2 menus on the table. It then took him 30 minutes before he came to take our order after taking that long to square a bill with other customers. The staff never offered to take a drink order while we waited. No coffee or even water. After he was done with the prior customers, the young, cold, uncourteous server came to our table and said, " Y'all want to place an order ?". I ordered, he wrote nothing down, then he turned facing sideways toward my gf and said, "You ?". Just like that. Very rude. No manners, no courtesy at all. We left. Canceled the order. It doesn't matter how good the food was. We will NEVER know. If the service is substandard, we don't spend our hard earned money there. That young man Is definitely in the wrong line of work.

mlPLsYcktq4kNqzqQRLVVw.text: I'm rarely in the area and was joined by fellow Yelper Andy T.  to check the place out. Can't recall what else I had aside from the chitlins but I know, we've had better. Nothing really remarkable. I've been to M&M in Los Angeles and Kathy's (prior to their move) to name a few which were much better experiences for Soul Food in my opinion.

saz-tk6MaPtqT5tmYICPMQ.text: I have been really wanting to try this restaurant for a while, but every time I would try and go they would be closed. When I thought about them this time they were just getting ready to close. So we ordered and took the food home. It was just ok, there was nothing exciting about the food. Everything could have used more flavor. I don't think it made that much difference that we took the food home.   We ordered the Catfish, Snapper and Meatloaf dinners(which came with three sides each.) All of them were dry and needed more flavor. The meatloaf, 1/2 inch thick with gravy, almost seemed like it was processed and had no juice, flavor, texture or color (like bell peppers, onions, tomato anything. The Snapper and Catfish were both fried and were very thinly cut.   They give you a nice amount of food for the cost. We had Mac & Cheese, Black Eye Peas, Fried Cabbage, Greens, and Yams. I loved the fried cabbage. The Yams were good, but could have used a tad more nutmeg. The meal came with cornbread muffins that were dry and boring.   The Black Eye Peas just tasted like Peas, and my 10 year old makes better Mac and Cheese. Not only could I not find the cheese but I could find any flavor. It was not the traditional Black Mac and Cheese that is baked with cheese. Greens were ok, nothing to discuss.   The worst part was the Peach Cobbler. I was excited when I saw the Peach Cobbler picture on the website, it looked delicious and flavorful. Instead of Peach Cobbler, I received two bowls of dough with maybe two peaches. I warmed it up for 45 secs like they suggested but that did not make any difference. It tasted like peach flavored bread, not like a cobbler at all.   The only thing that was good, was the service. They were friendly when I placed the order over the phone and when I picked it up.

uuotKgfPJ7AM1vSjcC64dA.text: Everytime I step foot in Vegas I always come here they have the best Soul Food!!!! So don't waste your time at other soul food places there garbage I Was there Thursday & Friday and had the fried Red Snapper with Collard Greens, Black eye peas, Macaroni Cheese, and  the bomb corn bread Everything was excellent!!!!!* The only thing the ##GRAVY## was way to ##SALTY## so somebody in the kitchen is to heavy handed with the salt back there!!!! Other than that well done  Very clean and waitress nice, friendly and  professional....

NJt5ra16HjI2tUoPD12s4A.text: The food here is first rate.  I would especially recommend the Oxtails.  The service is excellent, the people are very friendly and professional, but most of all, the food is fantastic, especially considering the reasonable pricing.

RAo0RIMYJNVSAaEk-LMIjw.text: When we came in we weren't sure if we were supposed to wait to be seated or seat ourselves. When we walked to the counter they told us to take a seat and they will ring us the menus. Took an hour for the dressing to get ready so they comped our meals when we said we were leaving. Food was very good.

Yh5mbXUsWN2lCKGWbiII7Q.text: No! The prices are too high for the food to taste like it did. It's not my cup of tea. They may need better cooks in the kitchen. My only used season salt and pepper for her food and it was fantastic. I think I tasted garlic in my gravy and I was not a happy camper. I gave the rest of my food to the dog and eventually to the trash. Everyone was rude except for a guy named Marquis I think... won't be back!

nnyja_L0AptorifuF_mhOg.text: Here again! The food, the food, the food was so good. My mamma's house would take second place, if I they didn't have such good service with a smile, which doesn't happen at my momma house. I enjoy the catfish with yams, collard greens, and rice as the lunch special. I got it quick and before I expected. Enjoy that place while in Las Vegas!

-nU8zWA6oAf1rs5arUPPSQ.text: We were in Vegas for the Thanksgiving weekend and decided to eat here on Friday.  I had theliver and onions with yams, rice with gravy and greens and my God was it good.  It was such delious food that I called my relatives and friens you lived in Vegas and we came back on Sat.  This time I had the meatloaf, fried cabbage, and blackeyed beans and again the food was awsome.   The waitress were also very nice and accommodating.   I will definitely  be back to EllaEms.  Every picture you see is exaxtly how your plate comes out.

0-4Z2m7k1O5vakt6Uq18TA.text: The waitress Jazzland was awesome. My mother and grandma came in from Ohio and she showed us some True hospitality. The food is also good, but the service will have me back! Ask for her it's worth it!

cge86TjcLiwNqx7uZ646Kw.text: Soul food should always come in portions this generous! $16 seems like a bit much to spend on a smothered porkchop plate, but then you discover the plate includes three chops and three generous side portions- more than enough to share! Chops themselves come with your choice of chicken or beef gravy, but the overall flavors were just okay. After craving this dish for a week and driving half an hour, it just didn't quite hit the spot, unfortunately.  Sides selected were mac, greens, and cabbage- I'm not even a fan of cabbage but their version was flipping delicious with bits of ham and good crunch without too much oil.  Too bad the other sides were so dismal- mac was a generous portion but super dry and the cheese was in large clumps as if my little sister were making it, while the greens were virtually flavorless aside from the heavy-handed dose of salt. Cornbread was decent, kept in a warmer that perhaps over-steamed it, as they had a mushy texture that I did not care for.  I was hoping to find an alternative to M&M, but unfortunately this place was more miss than hit for me.

r-IOyqesMCdDzrS-HnWVyA.text: In Vegas for a few days....my boyfriend had been telling me about this establishment and it did not disappoint!!  Excellent food, friendly service and a bomb music playlist during the lunch hour.  We WILL return!!!

-3BK42r4oPwZL_ja-ESsQw.text: Cozy diner style restaurant. Excellent service.  Delicious food.  Will definitely come back again

33Jldy9Hw0TjiJUgBJD9Pg.text: We called in our order and I picked it up...it was ready in 15 min. Piping hot.   The friendliness of the staff and how clean the place looked gave me a great feeling about their food.   We had the fried chicken and fried catfish meals. Each had awesome flavor but were a bit on the dry side. My faith was restored however in dipping each into the heavenly mash potatoes and gravy. Omg. I woke up at 2 am craving these potatoes! Our other sides were just as tasty...fried cabbage, Mac n cheese, rice, and these beautifully sweet yams. I'd go back for the sides alone.   The meals also came with corn bread and we ordered a German choc cake and a sweet potato pie. These were also very good.   If you are looking for some heavy hitting southern food this is the place to go. The hot sauce was also very good and I'm glad I have extras to use here at home!!

802oLAip2UuA8StzRInGFw.text: I ordered two pork chop plates and peach cobbler to go. When I got home there was no peach cobbler or any rice. I had to drive back which took me 25mins. Upon returning the waitress with the short gold ponytail who took order was rude. She grabbed bags sent the food back in the kitchen which I thought was unsanitary and yelled for the cooks to put rice on top of my pork chops. I asked if they were allowed to do so and she said yes. She was very unprofessional and mad at me as if it was my fault that my order was incorrect. She threw everything back in the back and gave me a free peach which was watery. The pork chops were tough as you can see I ate one and gave rest to my dog. I spent $41.06 for nothing had I not drove back before I would have driven back to get my refund!!!

ZhJxVFJScAfP11sbue5biQ.text: The food's great but the service leaves something to be desired.  One time for dinner, we waited for an hour for our food. After inquiring as to the status, they said it was still another 10 minutes. We just paid for our drinks and cornbread and left.  We've been here a couple of times before but this'll be the last; the service has gradually gotten worse.  The review was updated from a 5 star.

zUdB6aOYc4eR3n4fq8icsw.text: I expected the food to be really good but it just okay. I wouldnt recommend or go back. I ordered 5 meals for my family to go. So we had just about every side they offer on the menu. The only thing good was the potato salad and cornbread. The meats were good, the chicken and pork chops. The service was pretty decent. Also not sure if it was just the day we were there, but it was HOT in there. Also they offered a few different dessert but was out of all of them. i thought that was odd. The servers and cashiers were really nice.

EQP4i5qLY-nWxgTblxepCA.text: My first time in Las Vegas and I couldn't have had a better experience! What makes an awesome adventure is the food you eat on the way and Ella Em's Soulfood is the #1 place to go to if you want amazing food without the Las Vegas crowd. I got the yams with fried chicken and collard greens which was out of this world! Jazzland, our waitress, had so much patience with everyone and has such a great personality which made it that much better. Timothy, our other waiter, made sure we had everything we needed while cleaning and tending to other tables with Jazzland. Their work ethic is very impressive and the food is to die for. Definitely coming back whenever I'm in Vegas again.

Ww3LcXFHs3GttGEAUa0-yg.text: Im so done with supporting this place.   The service is completely horrible to were Im feeling damn near disrespected. The staff mess up your food/order and istead  of apologizing and trying to fix it they play and insult you. I have never experienced being blamed for the restaurant mistakes until this place.   The food is a 50/50 toss on consistency. The Mac and cheese for a soul food restaurant is actually under sub-par. The chicken, greens, and cabbage can be different tasting from day to day.   I have placed orders 3 times each time my order has been forgotten to be placed. Ive been told to pick up in 30 mins. I get there and Im waiting for 1 hour 30mins and longer. The funny thing is you arent offered a refund, discount, drink, or nothing. Service and accountability go a long way with me. I once only ate here for Sunday's. Well time to find new places.   And get a bigger space your kitchen is 5 times the size of the restaurant.

_8mbNCWZ_Lv29hsiP6_Gpg.text: Today was my first time eating here. The service was fast, very nice staff. I had the meatloaf, rice and gravy, and Mac and cheese. The food was really good, large portions, but I have to say after eating some by chest began to beat really fast. I truly believe it was in the seasoning of the meat or gravy. The portions were huge so I had some for dinner. Needless to say again after eating more of the food; I experienced the same feelings. I would return to the restaurant, but I would not order the meatloaf. In essence, I loved the meatloaf and gravy, but it didn't love me back. I am simply sharing my experience..

wLSYXZFknM7h03II3Oaftw.text: Once I moved in with my mom. I started eating at this place very frequently, I have tried their fried catfish, baked chicken with light/dark gravy, I love their collard greens, mac & cheese, yams (taste like candy) potato salad, red beans & rice, French fries. My mom loves their fried porkchops and okra! She's from down south so it's very hard to find fried okra! I LOVE their corn bread muffins, they always hook me with extra when I ask! My daughter loves their catfish, she won't eat anything else besides the corn bread. If my 3-year-old likes it, WE LOVE IT! Ladies are always sweet to me when I dine-in or pick up my food.

Eat at ur own risk

_CP443GYb3-_X_f_yHW-lA.text: What caught my attention was the batter their catfish was fried in, very tasty! As well as their chicken fried steak topped with gravy. Plus their homemade potato salad was great:) Same'ol fried chicken and waffles.

UHrof9VLOdX0_5XYp5mg4w.text: Came to Las Vegas on a whim to ring in the New Year (2019).  I knew I had to find black-eyed peas and collard greens to eat on the 1st (tradition believed to bring good fortune/prosperity and money during the year).  I googled this spot and I'm SO glad I chose this location!!!  The food was outstanding.  I ordered the catfish with my 2 sides (mentioned earlier).  My friend ordered country fried steak with the same sides.  Our food came out rather quickly and hot!  All the food was seasoned well and offered plenty (portions).  It's no mystery why this restaurant was voted as serving the BEST soul food in Las Vegas!  I definitely recommend this restaurant!

IGs_cvgrysCTL76Pp4-uRQ.text: I'm not sure if management has changed since the last time I visited, but I was disappointed with the food this time around. We ordered a grilled red snapper plate, and a fried red snapper sandwich. The fish was over cooked and dry on both orders. The menu says the sandwich comes with pickles, lettuce, tomato, and onion. Sounds good right? Well, it didn't come with any of that. Just dry fish and a bun! We ordered to go, so we didn't realize it until we got home.   I've told so many people about how good this place was, and now I'm embarrassed that I told anyone. I really hope this was a fluke, because they use to be so good. $30 is too much to spend for food that isn't cooked right. I highly doubt we'll be going back. I just can't see spending that much on a maybe.

Un7_wp36jAyy0n33ocGsww.text: The restaurant wasn't crowded. Service was good. Food presentation was good. My issue is the food wasn't. I had fried snapper (hard to chew, no seasoning), greens (cooked good but zero seasoning), macaroni and cheese (grainy taste, no flavor). Wanted dressing but was told the person who cooks it was on vacation so they didn't have any. Not sure how a restaurant only has one person who can make a dish on the menu. I can say I will not be back. My baby had the wings and waffle which he barely ate (I tasted it and it also lacked seasoning). My guy had the oxtails and said the gravy had seasoning which helped the flavor so oxtails and rice with gravy may be the way to go if your interested in stopping by. He said the fried cabbage was missing flavor as well.

jxsPoshXQYmKk-GQADQPOg.text: If you are craving soul food, don't go here!   A little misleading because they advertise like it's African American owned & operated but the owner/head cook is Filipino. As for the food, the fried chicken was pretty good but the mac 'n' cheese was NOT. It was too dry & unseasoned. It tasted like cheese & noodles were thrown together without anything else. The yams weren't well flavored either - I only tasted cinnamon and nothing else. #NotGood   But them greens though!!!! The greens were the best thing on the plate - delicious!! Also, the portion sizes were quite healthy & the cornbread was good too. The service was nice as well.  Overall, everything was okay but I would definitely not go back. I'd go back to Gritz instead.

KIiLHrrnkwMXI9vZlAk1RA.text: Soul food in Las Vegas! They service large portions on the meat. Seasoned lightly and the taste was fresh. Great staff and smooth atmosphere

AtoiT2uBrX7w9MmXTtTnMQ.text: I gave y'all 3 stars first time around because the food was good. We didn't even be seated we ordered to go but yet you're telling me $50 of food I gotta wait a whole hour to eat? You're customer service sucks you need more cooks and workers. Honestly just not worth coming at all no more.

zbu1evVlFrXwWCyld_PozA.text: Let me first say that the customer service that we received here was top notch!  Jaz (I believe that was the lady's name) helped us and the other gentleman helping out were both amazing. They made sure that our drinks were full and checked up on us regularly.  They were also very accommodating considering that our 3 year old was knocked out and the husband had to carry her while he ate his meal.  I felt like they took an extra step to make sure we were happy and our needs were met.  Not only that, but they even gave each of us a to go cup of their lemonade, even though we only ordered one.  I thought that was pretty cool of them.  Now the only reason why I am giving them a 3 star rating is because I thought the food could have been better.  A lot of their dishes were on the salty side.  Like their collard greens, fried okra, and fried cabbage.  My mother in law thought the same thing which is unfortunate cause we were both excited to try their greens.  Not only that, but their chicken fried steak and shrimp were both hard, dry, and salty.  However, my son's grilled pork chops were pretty good.  They came out piping hot and juicy.  Oh and their muffins were delicious!  We kept asking for more muffins, they were that good.    All in all, the experience itself was not bad.  Like I said, the customer service that we received was great, but the food could have been better.

cHOuISd9pQ-1m-mPdD-8aQ.text: We have been reading reviews for Ellla Ems for some time now and always wanted to try it. This past Sunday we were planning on trying breakfast at the new "Lumberjack's" restaurant on Craig rd. but when we arrived there was a 30 minute wait and we decided to see if Ella Ems served breakfast. They do not really serve breakfast but the waiter recommend the chicken & waffles which you could order with or without 2 eggs. All 3 in our party ordered the chicken and waffles with eggs. Everything came out hot, and everything on the plate was delicious. The fried chicken was excellent, the waffle fresh and a good size, two eggs were cooked just how we ordered them. We will be back to try the rest of the menu.

_CnmRmy24lEGzkS-jkVppg.text: I saw EllaEms on Groupon Now, but couldn't use it that day. Last week.my 80 year old mom and I were in the neighborhood and decided to give it a try. OMG! I had the smothered pork chops, mashed potatoes and gravy and fried cabbage. Everything was cooked perfectly and delicious. My mom, who has gotten really picky, said her catfish was the best she has ever had (and she's had plenty). she loved the mustard potato salad and french fries.(two items she is usually especially critical of) I know, 2 carbs, right? but she's 80 and can eat whatever she wants. The restaurant was clean and inviting, the server was friendly and helpful. Even my cranky mom had no complaints. This restaurant is 30 minutes from where I live, but it is worth the drive and we will be regular customers.

b-mnxBxRNsU6Hc24_d4eOg.text: Second time visiting EllaEms's. I sooo want to like this place especially since Granny reminds me of my Granny. I just love looking at her picture on the menu & in the restaurant. Service: A- I ordered take out and there was only one waitress who was cleaning, taking orders, etc. Price: B-A bit pricey but I can deal. Food: C/C- The food was just bland, bland, bland. No real seasoning. I'm from S. Carolina so I know down home cooking, but I was very dissapointed. I ordered the chicken (bland but fried good), fried cabbage (Ummmm so-so), and the macaroni (tasted like paper; wth)...Dont mean to be harsh but this food was not good. Seemed pretty busy so I'm guessing I'm outnumbered...Probably wont return for a 3rd time.

MAhl_Muid0XtLrWNvtJ9ZA.text: Just tried Ella Em's Soul Food for the first time.  DELICIOUS   I had ox tails, my favorite with gravy rice, yams and collard greens.  Everything was perfect.   The oxtails were tender and flavorful, the greens cooked just right, not too salty, not too heavy.  The yams were pretty and sweetened to perfection.  I'm a flight attendant so I dine on all kinds of food all over the world and believe me.  Ella Em's is the real thing.  I hope they stay around.  It's a 30 minute drive from my house, good thing it's not closer or my ass would be as big as a 747.  Worth the drive and the darling girl waitress is adorable.

0f9NpTXe-roHaoBhSgWc3A.text: one of the best catfish i've had.  i've tried so many and this one had so much flavor and yumminess.  will definitely be going back!

x_c1Tm0i8cidUm98wFz1Gw.text: Was in Las Vegas for a short while and never had soul food or could find any good while there. Until my friend who lives here suggested this place. And to my surprise I loved it the delicious fried chicken, greens, mac and cheese almost as good as my home cooking :o) And lets not forget the red velvet cake was delicious as well. If you haven't tried this little treasure of a place I highly suggest it, I'll try it again when I'm in a couple of months to make sure it wasn't just a fluke. And also to try something different on the menu, oh and to the person who felt they were forced to order a burger please the pleasure of going out to eat is getting what you want. Never let a cook or anyone persuade you other wise. Because after all you're paying the bill, so you could have easily left if they weren't fufilling your request for what you wanted. I patronize businesses that are there to please the customer, if that's not the purpose then why are they in business. Give them another try, and next time order what you want because I will. A satisfied customer, see you next time Vegas :o)

Diw2lCLarbyu2JP5dpRzVg.text: I gotta preface this review by saying, I'm not the biggest fan of soul food. My friends and I were in Vegas for the weekend and decided to try something new and off the beaten path of the strip or downtown. Ran a yelp search and found EllaEm's. Being just shy of 10 off the strip wasn't too bad.   I'm sooooo glad we rolled through! Got there about 2pm on a Sunday, the place was pretty busy. We grabbed a seat and quickly greeted by our waiter Q. He got our drink order and gave us sometime to look over the menu.   I was torn by a few different items... Oxtail? Meatloaf? Fried Chicken? Fried Catfish?  Aaaaaah! I don't know! Q rolls back to take our order, my friends were ready... Fried Catfish & Fried Snapper with collard greens, mac&cheese and red beads&rice. I asked for a recommendation and Q was on point... Meatloaf with a red sauce is his favorite and Thad good enough for me! I got the mac&cheese, fried cabbage and the red beans&price!  All three of us loved our meals. The Fish was flavorful and flakey... The Meatloaf was tender, juicy and so tasty! The red sauce was peppery and the tomatoes were sweet! Great flavor with the beef! All the sides were amazing, but the Red Beans&Rice straight stole the show! We were thanking God we each ordered our own! There was no sharing at this table!  All I gotta say... I'll be back... Actually, we'll all be back! And I'll definitely open up to more soul food spots in L.A. Thank you EllaEm's and the staff!

Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatloaf with red sauce awesome! Great recommendations from our waiter Q!

HCH0V1rXVqLk2eVJDw_N8Q.text: I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was so good, I was going to completely ignore the waffle. But the waffle was also amazing, a perfect compliment to the chicken. I also really enjoyed the kool aid and the cornbread pancakes.

s44n96Lg99sgIMru2nmXcA.text: Amazing food and great customer service. I got the catfish lunch special with 2 sides. My mother got the red snapper lunch special. We had Timothy as a waiter and he was great!! Will definitely  come back soon.

JXIAVoykEeDTW9v0SuejEw.text: Cornbread  best food I've had since I moved to Vegas 8 months ago! All the food is super good!! Needs to get more organized and they will be the best food spot period!! Really worth every penny and every minute waiting lol.

ivpmhdZQ6_lbyerHj_tVNg.text: Cutest cafe style soul food restaurant in Las Vegas. They have an excellent soul food menu that meets every eaters needs.  I'm giving 4-stars because I believe staffing could be improved. The staff/servers that  are there are outstanding, attentive, extremely courteous and they hustle almost to the point where they are out of breath when they reach your table. BUT...there needs to be more staff in high volume times to take phone orders as well as those dining in. I've been there four (4) times + each time staffing was the same. I've dined with 2 - 8 in our party + staffing has been the same. Tables aren't cleared/cleaned quickly.   Also, chairs could be more substantial for thick/plus size people. I'm a size 12/14, 5ft women and the chair is always uncomfortable. This takes away from my dining experience.   My group and I will continue to go as well as I will continue to refer friends but I'll also I'll warn friends about the situation. This may or may not be a deterrent.

xcUIhgPKNBMVVrOhTJc6iQ.text: Walked in to order some catfish asked the young lady I want to cat fish water how many fillets does that order come with and she tells me three fillets. I order it and she informs me since I'm paying with a card there will be a 50 cent up-charge (SMDH)    After waiting about 10 minutes for my order be only comes around the corner and hands me my order in a bag already tied up and it's looking very small so before I get up I open the bag and I see a hamburger container I opened the container and I see three small pieces now I'm remembering what the young lady said to me when I asked her how many fillets do I receive she said three well looking at this small hamburger container with three chopped up pieces of fish.  This order contains three catfish nuggets not fillets they chopped up one fillet into three pieces and charged me $11. NEVER AGAIN WILL I EVER PATRONIZE THAT ESTABLISHMENT. What a f---kin rip off. I should have went to Mario's instead.

The mac and cheese was the best I've had! Tasted homemade! The fried cabbage was tender and flavorful. From the moment we walked in to the moment we left Jazz took great care of us! Big thank you to her! We will definitely be coming back and will be recommending to anyone who asks!   Also thank you for the cake and to go drinks! You made our experience wonderful here!

YOFXA62n7L0x66sXT0lQfw.text: I wish this was closer to my house this would be a place I would frequent regularly. The staff is friendly and attentive. The food is amazing, they have the best soul food in Vegas and their portions are generous even on their lunch specials. My husband ordered the catfish, cabbage, and okra and his only complaint was there were no red pepper flakes in the cabbage. I got the pork chops Mac n cheese and yams. The food was cooked fresh, and seasoned just right! This is such a hidden gem and if you love soul food this is your spot! We have been 3 times and the food and service are consistent!

rQEnD7u15bN7ltHKEy-VwA.text: If you like authentic soul food you found it. From the amazing service with Arlanda to the fall off the bone ox tails the food here is next level! And the greens are delicious!

j09wQesmkeSrRs-RlswE8Q.text: Dining here was a wonderful trip down memory lane of how the ole school use to prepare and rock those southern staples. We ordered everything; staples like savory ox tails, meat loaf, catfish and grits, macaroni and cheese, liver and onions, greens, fried shrimp, fried snapper and too sweet iced tea and too sweet red Kool-Aid like it used to be. It's Soul Food Sunday every day at this restaurant.  I love the history of the business on full display. The decor is also a cultural tribute in and of itself. The service was a little slow, but the entrees and beverage service were just right.   The cake we ordered was undesirable. The food here is too good to serve subpar cake like this. They really should have their cakes shipped in from the southeast or have someone from the southeast come in and get their cake game together. If their cake game were tighter along with a little faster service this would be a five+ star treat on any scale, but until then, please know that Las Vegas is lucky to have Ella'ems.

t5EbwBeUDOYorMwyNxUn-A.text: Another great spot that is not on the strip is EllaEm's.  If you're looking for soul food......really good soul food...you need to add this place to your list.  We arrived during the week shortly after they opened and surprisingly they were empty and we were thankful we didn't have to wait as some other reviews stated.  Our waitress gave us plenty of time to check out the menu and ask questions which we really appreciated.  I decided on the smothered chicken, cabbage and mashed potatoes and gravy.  The food came out hot and freshly cooked.  The smothered chicken was tender and delicious.  The cabbage was seasoned and cooked really well and the potatoes were just as good.  My friend enjoyed her meal as well and we were very happy with our experience here.

xrGYjWX6UHaDyZzwOhjRCQ.text: I came here a few times a month a year ago when I lived on this side of town. It was so good! I would always get fried chicken, rice n gravy, and mashed potatoes. I came back a few months ago I went and the food wasn't the same. Not sure if they changed recipes or the cooks weren't trained properly, but I was so disappointed.

jBddvTMEzcpOgdKNBltLfA.text: The best soul food I have had in a LONG time. I have lived in the South and was raised Southern..This reminds me of my Grandma's good for the soul cooking with a modern day twist. This will be my spot everytime I visit Vegas!!!

4RUXqKBpRlPPeiubKQv6Eg.text: Great service even though the place was packed and there was only one waitress.  Awesome lunch menu.

0TbzIOlBhxYZ9kuEhUu74g.text: After a full night of hardcore Vegas-style partying, I was in dire need of a fried chicken fix. We found EllaEm's Soul Food, and, BINGO! Exactly what I needed. The cafe style restaurant was very clean. I saw a few framed reviews on the walls raving about this place saying, it had "The Best soul food in Vegas of 2010." I ordered the smothered chicken with collard greens, mash potatoes, and mac & cheese. We got it to-go and I couldn't wait to dig in. Whoa. Talk about a total food orgasm. Now, to all my fellow Yelpers, I will say no more about this place; only because I was extremely impressed beyond words. Therefore I insist that when you visit Las Vegas, this place is a must! I can't really begin to describe how great the food was. It sucks that I live here in San Diego...especially now since I will be craving those collard greens from Las Vegas. Geez.

BSw7nnweca9aGcnnglTUYA.text: It gets no better. If your looking for spectacular soul food, EllaEm's is the spot. If you're in the Las Vegas area, make time to stop by this place. EVERYTHING on the menu is amazing. I can't speak highly enough of this place.

N4_Q2wYHQ8i6zwnDReGocA.text: A pile of well-seasoned catfish, solid greens and a mountain of mac and cheese for $7. Yeah, that'll do. Server was friendly and attentive. Not much more needs to be said -- if you're heading out Craig Road, great spot for lunch.

pdWHTJ-0YnUO7lEjNsTnoQ.text: Great food... Had the Ox tails with Mac and cheese... Great food, cooked right gravy was on point, the corn bread hit the spot.... The Mac was pretty good and they give you a lot of ox tails also....

teDahtMqoDfz-RYhe9Esxg.text: super delicious. The best part? it's right next door to us. So glad we finally get a decent soul food in LAS VEGAS PERIOD. Whether you dine in or do a take out, it;s sure to be a tummy filled meal.

cd5vcYxoziPA7B5ysvQb-g.text: Introduced to this place on Monday this week, been here everyday since for lunch.  Best Catfish and Meatloaf ive ever had.  After having a meal here my belly feels so warm and satisfied.. Makes a crappy day amazing!! Will be back here very often.

IRlgGs1mwFTnUQcT8WVQrg.text: Came hungry and left so satisfied. Can I get an amen from the church about that catfish and those greens. Good Lordy. Definitely worth checking out when in town!!!!  Tell em' Lani sent ya!

zTSdk8Ueoq6ni7QdBI5w4A.text: I was Visiting Vegas for my Girls B day and we stopped in hoping to have some great soul food and Ella Ems did not disapoint ! The wait staff was very friendly  and we were seated quickly and with a smile! I order the Catfish , mac and cheese and greens and every bite was delish! There portions are huge and prices are very good! I could not finish everything and had to take some back with me but it was so good @ 3am coming back from a long night out! If great Soul Food is what your in the Mood for make sure u pay this spot a Visit !!

C1tTjGirDCosgTRUTTQOZQ.text: Moving here from Chicago, I just never thought about soul food in Vegas., but after today,,, Man o man!  The Oven baked ribs were on point as well as the black eye peas, fried cabbage and yams!  I will be back!

K98rduMCjsSk8HWSODA4JQ.text: My husband and I went here on Valentine's Day for breakfast. Since we were the only one's there it was really intimate. We ordered the Chicken n Waffle breakfast, VERY GOOD. We will go back again but it will be for dinner. :)

BbSr4HbfaelO6rU_C5H-EA.text: The only place in town I that I know of that sells chitterlings.. Only reason I didn't give it  more stars is bcuz the food is a little bland!

0I_i7Y2ucqhpdqXnRbPeeQ.text: Delicious food and service. Our waiter was attentive and helpful. The food was well-prepared, fresh and delicious. The menu offers quite the variety, so it was difficult to choose an entree.  We all selected something different and tried one another's food. It was all tasty! Will definitely return.

iICkm0vcsd_5qnxKodiUkg.text: came here wendsday with couple of co-worker place had few ppl i had grilled catfish , mac and potato salad ... catfish was great but mac was bland and potato salad had no flavor and tasted old and griddy my coworker barely ate his food.. ribs were dry and veggies were cold greens he says wer great :( dont know if we'll be coming back here...

sPiA-Aj9-tapHmpvGIE0RA.text: I went to EllaEm's today. I ordered the lunch portion of the baked chicken with mac n cheese and yams. First, the chicken was under cooked. Second, the yams were 99% sugar. They were so sweet to the point I couldn't enjoy them. I love yams so you can image how disappointed I was.  People cautioned me not to go there but I believe in trying things for yourself. With that said, I will not be back to EllaEm's.

ekczeGczfHY5KLwnhAD7UA.text: I have to rate this place a one. Because i drove 10 miles thinking yes i can't wait so i can tell my wifey. I came for soulfood and  the cook assit for me to try a buger. Well i did because it's black cooks and blacks that cook soul food can cook a juices tastey burger. Well NOT!!!!!!!!!!!! Ellaem's disappointed me and now my wife and i have to still drive out to Cali just to get some good soul food. Ellaem's is neat and clean inside with friendly folks. But Ellaem's is very nest and clean with a large tv on the wall to watch while waiting for your food or while eatting. BUT Ellaem need to prep up on cooking there food better and that's soul food and not subjecting that a burger over soul food. Heck if i want a good burger i would have went to the Burger Bar. 1 star for this Ellaem's because I HAD BETTER.

7DgKTYt-SDtXDolKA3YoMw.text: My husband and I stumbled upon EllaEm's randomly one night. The service was top notch. I ordered the Fried Chicken sandwich and my husband ordered the Smoothered Chicken. I am giving the location a 3-star only because I wasn't a big fan of the sandwich. My husband truly enjoyed his dish. From what I was able to try without being attacked, my husband's Smoothered Chicken was great! I noticed everyone says you have to try the gravy, yes the gravy is good. I however, LOVED the corn bread.

ts3qqVZRT4jOaS0N0QKHFA.text: This place has only been open for about two weeks.  I had the liver and onions with yams, green beans, and peach cobbler.  You will leave full, but you will not have enough for a doggie bag because the portions are smaller than normal.  I think it is because they are new.  On another note, you get three sides and a small piece of cornbread with your entree.  I was shocked that we got three sides.  My guess is that once EllaEm's turn a profit, the portions will increase which is understandable.  I must say that my liver and onions were the best I've ever eaten.  Everything was d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s!  The service was outstanding as well.  I can see that they are really focusing on customer service.  In contrast to ALL of the other local soul food joints in Vegas, they have the cleanest/nicest dining room.  This place will get my business and my support because they are trying to do it right.

photos.caption: Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu Cover
Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining Room

tvDF_5R0VSB4Zgu6FBthlQ.text: Sundays are packed as the local community has started coming in.  I found the portions to be pretty good myself (especially for the three sides); but in a buffet town I could see where some people may find them small.  You can get many of the dishes fried or grilled (I've had the catfish fried and the red snapper grilled -- both good.)  I have to agree with Mrs. P though, the liver and onions (with gravy of course) were really good.  Great find in North Las Vegas!  Highly recommended.

Jnh9m2i0MVKtDspGBsQ0eQ.text: We decided to have dinner here on Friday night after reading some of the reviews.  My fiancee is from NC so his taste buds are hard to please when it comes to southern food. Upon entering there were 3 ladies (servers I assume, they were all wearing black) and one couple having dinner. The decor is nice and enjoyed the "home-like" feeling of the Granny pictures. They must have satellite radio and the best radio station ever, it was warm, inviting, and even a little romantic at times with the selection of music, soul, jazz and R&B. The server immediately came to our table and took our drink order. My Fiancee had the fried chicken dinner with greens, Mac n cheese and yams. I enjoyed the catfish with the same three sides except I had the mashed potatoes instead of yams. They were all very large portions, the food was nice and hot and yes, everyone is right, the corns bread is pretty yummy...................but can we talk about the catfish???? Even if you are not a fish lover, you should try this!!!! It is crispy on the outside, the breading or whatever they use is not to thick or overpowering, it's perfectly seasoned and crunchy, but wait, when you get to the fish.....OH MY! It is like butter; it melts in your mouth and is so delicious you would never even think it is fish. Definitely the best WE have ever had (yes I had to share, the meal was large) I am not from the south, but have visited NC and eaten catfish at many other places before and this is by far the best I have ever had. The server, ( I am sorry I do not remember her name) was also very helpful, when I explained this was our first time there and may need assistance suggesting dessert, was very pleasant and helpful. As they got busier, (many people were coming in to pick up to-go orders) and three more parties came in, we were constantly checked by the other servers, asking not only if we were ok but if there was anything else they can get for us. Overall, we were extremely happy and will definitely go back!

E6G98mPxcesP-EBMzqFJJw.text: Mrs. A..... I have read the "Complaint" that you have wrote and I have come to this conclusion.... You are NOT keeping it real, you are just the bitter "ex-worker" who got fired... I find this VERY unprofessional of you. I'm not going to go back and forth with you, but because you posted your childish complaint with my name, I felt the NEED to reply. - Keep this in mind - "To Each is his own" - My experience, If you want some good soul food, great atmosphere, good owner as well as servers and cooks... Go to EllaEm's and try it out for yourself....  *Be aware of bitter ex-servers, they'll sabotage anything... Smoooccchheeezz!

OFvRD3LDbZ4ISAFm36BkTw.text: I have eaten at EllaEm's a few times.  So far my experience has been a very good one.  The fried catfish, fried chicken wings, yams and collard greens are delicious!  I normally go during the day.  The staff is also very pleasant and accommodating every time I go.

wyTZpaJINAyNqPCRj-ObXA.text: Great food, nice atmosphere and friendly staff.

WhlNjGB744hhfSj300UFTg.text: Great atmosphere. Amazing food. Friendly service. Definitely a place we will go again!!!

Tla_HJS8b94FoFiDbxZZBA.text: This place was pretty good and the waitress was really nice to us. She brought my toddler some extra corn bread because that's the only thing he would eat lol! I ordered the fried pork chops (pretty good), collard greens (delish), fried cabbage (blah), and mac & cheese (amazing). My husband had fried chicken and waffles and he loved it. The portions were huge. My only complaint was the restaurant wasn't very nice and the bathrooms needed TLC. I think we will order take out from now on but it was very good soul food.

ZGY_s1bdrG9Yc6hmXQ8uRA.text: Ox tails, mac&cheese, fried cabbage, potato salad & to top it off GRANNY'S GERMAN CHOCOLATE CAKE!!!! YUMMY YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!!! :) not to forget bout the awesome service & the cleanliness of the restaurant, but the food really is delicious!!!

7s3_U8QDRSCyiIgqfmY4Gw.text: Worst customer service ever. Wanted to try out a new spot around my area was definitely unimpressed. Went in with 3 other friends and ordered our food to go. When we got home and opened it up to eat it everything was wrong. One of ours was completely different from what he ordered and the other forgot his cobbler that he paid seperate for. I ordered the chicken and waffles and it didn't even have any chicken in it. We went back to get our orders fixed and came in to a waitress with an attitude who didnt feel the need to try to help out. After standing there for a second another customer in the store said his name was the same as my friends and come to find out the completely wrong order that went all the way back to our house and all of us ate because we were hungry in the first place they tried to give to him as if that was his fresh order. If we didn't say anything to him he would have taken it! After that we sat there for another 15 mins and when the food that she brought us out to replace sat behind her for a good five mins and she never brought it out. Not even any attempt to make up for their mistakes either with something for free our anything at all, just attitude. And apparently their manager "doesn't work there." All in all none of our food was good and if it was it wasn't by the time we got to it because we had to wait so long. Got a floppy waffle and some mediocre chicken AND missed the first quarter of the Packers game. Don't waste your time with this place.

2yndV1KQl8srPeSNrluiow.text: My best friend and I have been twice in the last month, and I must say, it's that good. I had the fried cabbage for the first time and ended up ordering a side of it to go. Two thumbs up!!

75ws5xcqDA5IQlOqPlOZgQ.text: Had lunch 1/30/15, was awesome food. Reminded me if great food from the south. I had the meat loaf with the "Red sauce"...yummy! My waiter "Q" was very helpful..knew what to order! JV

vfBYu506l3XVO7wXFhltnw.text: This little gem is about 20 minutes from the strip and well worth the trip.  Great customer service and the food was delicious.  Everything came out piping hot and tasted great!  I had the chicken and waffles, some of the best I've had.

PsbqQSWbiJk9CRwoL6RYog.text: First time here and will be back. Great food and service. Pork chops,collard greens, red beans and rice and mashed potatoes, everything perfect. Fried catfish was really good also

QvhIBITPlIms9yBU25sDgw.text: Found them tucked away while searching for a quick bite for me and two kiddos under 4. Short and sweet...this is the purest and freshest soul I've had in a while and we just moved from the south. Firstly,  we were greeted by a really nice staff who had recommendations ready.  I went with the fried cat fish and chose mac n cheese, collard greens, black eyed peas, and an extra side of fried okra. The meal also came with corn bread muffins and they even gave me a couple extra for the kids and my hubby who had the leftovers. The muffins were moist and light in sweetness and density,  delicious and balanced. The fried fish and okra had a great batter and were cooked perfectly and didn't have an oily taste. The collards and beans were so fresh, not fatty, and tasted great; my kids loved them. My kids didn't go for the mac n cheese, but only because their taste buds are ruined by the boxed stuff. I will be back again.  There aren't many choices along Craig for those nights I don't feel like cooking and you can go easy on the wallet and waist line if you split the meal and get an extra side ir two or you can go grilled and stick to veggie options. The desserts looked great...maybe next time.

7hynqrWV0U4aJ2YXGg1yxw.text: This place is DELICIOUS!!! Allyson was great as our server. The yams are amazing. We will definitely come back again!!  ;-)

OCxmxeXM9Mmmq_uqMwcugg.text: Went in on our last night in Vegas, so it wasn't crowded. The service was good & the place was neat & clean. We had oxtail. Short ribs, fried chicken, snapper, greens, fried okra, candied yams, rice & gravy, Mac & cheese and fried cabbage. Everything was superb!! The food had lots of seasoning & flavor to it. We're definitely going back there when we come back to Vegas!!! Thank you Ellaem's for making our last night a memorable one!!

3VX3Dy0CbgksTC1GkaAbVw.text: being married to a Southern boy, and living in the South for so long this place makes soul food  like home again I have the pork chops with collards black eyed peas and mashed taters.Great atmosphere the waiter ,waitress is wonderful it's really a down home kind of place...... now I know where my new Sunday night dinner place is can't wait till Sunday to try something else new.

w85pqUHieFyYu3w1J9h8KQ.text: Delicious place to eat.  Alison is a wonderful waitress and very friendly.  Second day in a row we decided to come back for more.

p3hSRzX3KyqoQHLWRbgcew.text: If you're in north town and craving some good ol' fashioned soul food, you definitely gotta try this place out! Their prices are good for the amount you get and the inside is very clean and welcoming, considering the poor location choice, which is in a plaza on Craig road and Revere -where stores are constantly closing and new businesses open left and right. If it is your first time and want something other than their really good fried chicken, YOU MUST TRY THE FRIED CATFISH! I don't know what they do to the catfish, but there is no fishy taste at all. (you know what I'm talking about) It's very clean tasting and the seasoning and batter is not overpowering, making this light crispy fish a must try. The sides totally compliment the food and leave me stuffed and satisfied. If you're thinking this is just your ordinary soul food joint think again, there's plenty of SOUL and HEART stirring up in this kitchen.

5pUWou6-RCgrwfRtcSvr2A.text: Sometimes you just need some soul food in your life. We came here pretty much at closing and there was no problems.. no "the kitchen is closed we are sorry" we were greeted very nicely..thank goodness! because I really wanted soul food that night. The food was good, but the service was amazing!!! Jaz (I think was her name) was very good. So overall I think I would come back here when I am in town. Thanks!

papmKi3nWx4tmPvI9jR9Cw.text: This was my first visit, fantastic service!  The food?  Eh.     Service was good, but a little TOO on you to place your order.  I literally just walked into the door and was taking off my jacket and the young man was on me asking if I was ready to place my order.  Not my drink order, but my food order (I asked), and it was like that for the first 15-20 minutes we were there, every 3-4 minutes we were being asked to place our order.  I could understand if they were busy, but there were only 2 other people in there. My friend and I just wanted to chat for a minute before ordering, but we both felt like they were getting irritated, so we ordered.  I got the red snapper (1/2 the filet grilled, 1/2  fried), with mac n cheese and fried cabbage.  Now first, their cornbread was VERY good (maybe make them a little bigger?), loved the cornbread, they were just a little small.  Not worth the $.50 to get another one.  The fried cabbage was also VERY delicious, still had some crunch to it after being cooked and very flavorful with plenty of juice served with it.  Unfortunately, I had to send back the mac n cheese.   It looked like it was a few days old and had absolutely NO creaminess or taste to it.  It was also oily and badly separated, and stirring it didn't help.  I really hated to, but I sent it back and got the mashed potatoes with brown gravy, which were very, very good.  Potatoes were smooth, soft, hot, and well seasoned, as was the gravy.  The snapper, both grilled and fried, was WAY overcooked and very, very, very dry.  The flavors were very good, a good combo of spices, but I couldn't realky enjoy it because I had to take a bite of one of my sides along with the fish so I could swallow. There was no other other way to eat it, it was THAT dry.   I didn't send it back, though, bc I felt really bad about sending back the mac n cheese.    I had a pleasant experience, it's a cute place where you can hold a conversation with someone without being drowned out by music.  They had GREAT music in the background, btw, classic R&B.    But-for the pressure to order as soon as I got in, the service was wonderful...I think I ticked our server off by returning stuff, but he was still polite, and the young lady was VERY nice, I don't think the smile left her face!! LOL.  I'll give it another try and will obviously order something else.  *  Absolutely no offense is intended, but let me make some mac n cheese for the Executive Chef to taste.  Again I don't mean to offend, but more than 1 customer complained about this side and I'd love to try....

ghduXUD-qxadoCmYB2mSOQ.text: 5 stars! I love EllaEm's soul food! I have been here multiple times because of their chicken and waffles. The chicken and waffles portion is pretty big. It comes with a big waffle and 3 chicken wiings/leg. It can feed the both of us. Sometimes we will just add a few sides and an extra waffle to make us extra full. I admire how they keep their food nice and fresh. Everything that we have tried is always so delicious. Their mac and cheese isn't too salty and has the right amount of seasoning and cheese. Their mash potatoes with brown gravy is delicious too. It always tastes fresh like they just whipped some up just for you and your plate of food. Their potato salad is yummy! It has that little bit of sweetness and tartness from the mustard, I would love to take some on a picnic. Ha! Their cornbread always comes out warm with a bunch of butter. My fiance loves their cornbread, I don't blame him. It has the crunchy outer texture and the inside is soft and warm. Yummm. Just thinking about their food is making my mouth water! I believe everything they make, they make with love which is why I gave them 5 stars. Prices are worth it too.   I love the inside of the restaurant too. They kept it nice and simple and kind of True to the type of food they make. Nothing is too fancy, you can comfortably eat and feel cozy. The walls have posters and they have pictures of their family members and I love it. The servers also remember who you are if you eat there twice within a week. Haha. I don't regret it. I absolutely love EllaEm's!  Oh! They also do trays of food which is nice... So maybe one Thanksgiving I won't make any food, but I'll order all my food from here!

yK3bIX99qwRSRcJujR7uZg.text: We enjoyed the food & service.  We had the chicken & waffles, catfish, and country steak.  No complaints here. My kids loved the mac n cheese.  Love the cornbread too.  We'll be back again.

XKshgPg5ayNctD8RvaHkTw.text: The food in EllaEm's is excellent!!! The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because of the service.  My family and I have bought food there many times we have ate in and ordered for pickup. Today 8/31/2018 we were trying to call in for a take out order. First it took about ten minutes to get thru and it wasn't a busy signal i got it was a message to leave a message. When I did get thru they put me on hold for another ten minutes. So after we ordered we were not to far away to get there to pick up the food then get home... now this was about 2:20p.m. While giving the lady my order she couldn't hear because of the music and was also talking to someone in the background. That was okay better to get the dinner order right.  When I arrived I stood at the counter waiting for someone to help me and was totally ignored. The ladies there just look at you, don't greet you and look like they wished I wasn't there and they weren't there either.  If the food wasn't good and I didn't feel like cooking and had already given my debit card I would have walked out. The other thing that just gets on my last good nerve is when you order your sides they don't know what they have available they have to check for instance dressing, cakes, cobbler, and etc. if this is a restaurant the order taker should be aware of what is available. If there is no communication from the kitchen it can be chaos for the front of the house. This place is like Gordon Ramsay's 24 hours to Hell and back, or his Hell's Kitchen.  My advice is if you want great soul food eat here. My advice is if you have time to waste and be ignored and get your mouth watering for a side you want only to be told "let me check to see if that's available and then be told no we out". Then for you my friend eat here!  I think next time I'll try ordering a dinner meal at 11:00 a.m. when everybody is fresh and in a good mood...

m4__s8VDzHiVKpQo0DVUmA.text: The food looked much better online than it did in my togo box. At first glance I thought the Mac and  Cheese was gonna be nasty, but it wasn't as bad as it looked, but not what I expected from a soul food spot. I ordered the catfish lunch special. The fish was really good. The cornbread muffin was really good. I was not impressed with the yams either. I ordered over the phone and had to give my card info before they would start the food...... Anyways I think this place is over priced, but there were a lot of people in the restaurant. I'll give it another try before I am completely done.

8cgQ97wpCT1cQHjJ6aXufg.text: Came in to place a to go order. Waited a little less than an hour for my order (wasn't super busy or slow).  So don't expect a speedy order. I ordered the Catfish Special. Comes with 3 sides (a bit excessive, imo) and a cornbread muffin. Came out close to $20. I ordered macaroni and cheese, fries and red beans & rice as my sides. The catfish and fries were tasty. Macaroni was decent. Disappointed with the red beans & rice, probably would've been better had rice not been so dry/overcooked. I was satisfied overall. Willing to try more of the menu. The staff was very friendly.

vJ0W56m-NLw5Y9rcFe9h0w.text: We went here for one of my son's birthday. It was a nice small spot. I really liked the pictures they had on the walls.  When we walked in nobody really greeted us even though one of the waitress was literally two feet away from us. We seated ourselves. We all order sweet tea to drink. It was water down. I ordered the smothered chicken with beef gravy with rice and gravy, collard greens and yams. My son ordered chicken fried steak with french fries, potato salad, macaroni and cheese. The birthday boy ordered fried chicken salad sandwich and french fries. My food came and it was baked chicken with my sides. It wasn't smothered in any type of sauce. I asked if i can have a side of gravy for my chicken. I wasn't impressed with my food. My son said his chicken sandwich was pretty good. My other son's food was tough meat with beef bland gravy on top. He didn't like his sides at all.

photos.caption: Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with beef gravy and the sides are macaroni and cheese and potato salad. Meat was tough.
Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was supposed to be smothered chicken with collard greens, yams,and rice and gravy but They gave me baked chicken.

ICYDKPm-rN7nnwbQGMTULQ.text: Pretty solid and delicious soul food!   They had mixed up our order, so instead of taking it back...they let us keep the extra plate then brought out the corrected order! How awesome was that! Lots of businesses take it back, I always wondered what they did with an uneaten plate. Do they throw it away? Serve it to someone else? Gross. I'm regressing.  I had their oven baked ribs. Deliciously baked! Lathered in bbq just the way me likey. Husband had the liver and onions. Of course the husband enjoyed his! Lol. He really loved their fried cabbage. Their mac n cheese was pretty yummy too, and I'm not a complete mac-n-cheese person. Their prices are pretty decent too. Soul food in other areas of this world charge soul food like catfish is a rare species, collard greens are grown from gold, and ribs are a season.   Anyway, awesome to have deliciously prepared comfort food nearby. Definitely recommend them. Service was great! Seeing family pics on the wall just feels nice. Reminds you they are deep with their roots. That's probably what makes them deelish. It's homely.

co_P_0QVneD0ZVm20RGKJA.text: Great customer service and the food was on point. I had the Mac n cheese, fried cabbage and red snapper fish, it was seasoned perfectly, you get a good amount of food for a very reasonable price. I definitely will be back

pa46xtCmYE2F0LP5k8XVYg.text: Amazing....4 different orders and everything was Great...Service was wonderful...definitely commands a repeat visit when in town!

df8ocBJI7Z-iSIxHU8JozA.text: The food is great but the service is lacking. I went there for lunch and there were only 4 people in the restaurant and I waited 30 minutes to find out they never placed my order. During that time at least 12 more people were served.

vetqaeTwo4vLfqXSL0H1tg.text: It's always best to call in your order because it takes can take a while. But it is always worth the wait.   This is my go to when I dont feel like cooking but I want my family to have a home cooked meal.

EQYJT3s6egcrtnF6_FkhZA.text: Okay so I usually never write bad reviews but this is strictly in reference to the "catfish" fillet, it is NOT catfish at all, it is Swai. I wouldn't complain but when I asked the waiter he agreed that it wasn't catfish.   The sides I got were pretty good though; greens, candied yams, and Mac n cheese (could have been more creamy and less greasy) but all around were good.   I highly suggest ordering something else.

photos.caption: Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy catfish fillet with yams, greens, Mac n cheese and side of corn bread

Yuw8BmkyTQEJKO4cSZOpPA.text: When you think of Soul Food, Catfish comes to mind. No, not the stupid reality show on tv but the real actual fish. Here they do have it with your choice of it fried or grilled. They also have Chicken n Waffles. I took my 12 year old son with me to check this place out. We did ended up getting the Catfish and the Chicken n Waffles.  The Chicken n Waffles were pretty good. You get 3 nice sized chicken wings, a waffle, and eggs any style you want. The chicken was crispy and slight breading to it. The waffle was just ok. I was expecting to be at least a little more crispy than it appeared. The eggs we got scrambled. Nothing special to note there.  The Grilled Cajun Catfish was good as well. Came with your choice of 3 sides. I picked Mashed Potatoes with Beef Gravy, Mac n Cheese, and Mixed Veggies. This is where I got really disappointed. The Catfish was decent but all the sides tasted a bit bland and was lukewarm. The veggies were definitely not fresh because it was partially soggy, it looked lifeless, and was chewy when I took a bite. The Mac n Cheese tasted like what I make my kids at home with the instant microwave stuff. It's not fancy but it is good enough for them. Here at a restaurant that is unacceptable. Last but not least, the Mashed Potatoes were a bit dry. Maybe they didn't put enough water or milk in the mix before putting it in the microwave?  As for service, they are a bit slow here. We came in at 6:45 pm on a Tuesday night. There were only two other tables occupied at the time. We got our food I would say about 15 minutes later. After about 5 minutes both our drinks were empty. Another 5 minutes later I had to ask for a refill on both our drinks. Rule of thumb, if you have to ask for refills after so much time has passed, that is not good service.   In closing, I would stick to ordering the Chicken n Waffles and Catfish. Stay away from the sides, well at least what I ordered. To be fair I cant assume everything was nuked. I also would like to try other items so I can give them the benefit of the doubt especially if it warrants updating this review. Until then, its 2 stars for me.

tN-_SxQ_Z3HfQluS-STeTQ.text: Items Selected: Cornbread Muffins Fried Chicken, Chicken Gravy, Fried Okra, Mac n' Cheese, Candied Yams Sweet Potato Pie Red Velvet Cake  Tucked away in a strip mall on West Craig Road in North Las Vegas, but frequented by locals and those within the proper city limits for what some consider to be the best Soulfood in The Valley, it was just after 5pm that I entered the stripped down confines of  EllaEm's for a bite before dinner and although several take-out orders unfortunately caused a rather lengthy delay from the kitchen one would be hard-pressed to name another place offering a more authentic experience, particularly at such a price.  Not at all billed to be the upscale experience of Yardbird and far less often discussed than either location of underwhelming M&M Soul Food Cafe found further South, it was at a four-top surrounded by a crowd of all ages and ethnicities that I was seated mere moments after entry and perusing the menu it a young Hispanic hostess offered smiling greetings before filling water and presenting the first of two rounds of complimentary cornbread muffins, each bite tinged with sweetness amidst a delicate yet toothsome base.  Offering a la carte options, but generally a far better deal when ordered as a combo or traditional "Meat + 3," it was in rejecting temptation offered by fried pork chops as well as several other entrees that my original target of EllaEm's signature fried chicken was selected and although attempts to add-on a waffle were thwarted by poor kitchen timing the nearly thirty minute wait was rewarded by two legs and a thigh of crisply breaded brined bird, the spice profile well represented straight through the skin and into the flesh while sides of yams and fried okra were reference standard in execution, the man & cheese largely forgettable with overcooked noodles plus a soupy thin sauce.  Apologies offered by the young server for the missing waffle and delays that were in no way her fault, there was little doubt that a meal at any Southern eatery was likely to end without a sampling of dessert, and although the lack of banana pudding would seem to be a serious menu oversight both the small slice of warm red velvet cake and one of Sweet Potato pie were far better than one may have expected, the former far sweeter than other cocoa-laden iterations while the latter atop a crisp and flaky crust impressed by taking the traditional savory route.  ****No doubt one of "Hidden Gems" of North Las Vegas, an area oft lamented for a dearth of quality places to dine, EllaEm's offers not only a relative bargain for the dollar but also some of the city's very best fried chicken and Red Velvet Cake, no small praise considering the omnipresence of each on menus throughout town.

1i-B64f2bzn12FM87LF2XA.text: I said I was going to give EllaEm's 4 stars, but looking back, I don't know what they could have done better. I went here with the work gang for a semi-going away lunch before my maternity leave. Everybody recommended the fried catfish, and although I am not usually a huge fan of catfish (what's with that gritty-like texture), I caved to peer pressure and decided to try it. Great choice! The fish itself was light and flaky and the batter was delicious and a little spicy. So good. Also, the lunch special came with 3 (3!) fillets, so that was more than enough. The lunch special ($8 I think) also comes with 2 sides, of which I chose yams (delicious and sweet, just like I like), and mac & cheese (good, typical soul-food stuff). Others at the table ordered the greens, the fried cabbage, and the mixed veggies, and the only complaint I heard was about the mixed veggies. Oh and they also brought out delicious homemade corn muffins before the meal! The service was friendly and prompt and the iced teas (sweet & unsweet) were all delicious, too! Overall, this place was so good that I might consider venturing up to north town just to bring my husband here!  Note to management: can you please heat up your butter or serve it in a bowl soft or something? Trying to spread those hard packets on our corn muffins almost ruined them!

_1sX94e3VzmjJ8lCwv3XKg.text: Great food...We had an older lady as our server she was scattered not organized at all and we chose a suitable table she instructed us to sit where she wanted us too...Again great food...Service eh.... Martha Carter of Fontana Ca.

-tbzvihaRxLywJSoFD41Tw.text: Food was awesome, but to super long to get with not many patrons at the time of 8pm, plus only one waiter, on Valentines night, felt bad for him then felt bad for the people who came in at 830pm and were turned away only to ask : " but on the front door doesnt it say you close at 9pm?!"...my lady ordered the Wingettes n waffles which were the bomb and I ordered the country fried steak, which was super good but it was cut into 4 pieces of what looked to be a small piece, though it was filling, the service really could use some help. I actually parked in front of the hawaiian place and wanted to eat there but looked over and decided to give this Soul Food joint a try, all in all the food was awesome, service not so much. I only tipped the boy because he looked so overwhelmed and deserved it!

8kauOoW_gQNzifNy_upR6A.text: I came here on a wednesday, during my lunch break, and ordered the lunch special: chicken with collard greens and rice and gravy. Military discount 10%, came out to 8.   - YUMMY cornbread! Can I get another :)? - One salty piece of chicken and the other made perfectly with the right crisp. Weird. - I shouldn't have gotten the rice and gravy. Average. May I should have gotten yams or mac and cheese? french fries?! - Collard greens are okay. I tasted that bitter after flavor after awhile.  - SLOW SERVICE! If you have an hour lunch, don't expect to be at work on time. - Unique? I like the decor and music (High school flashback R&B)! OBAMA :D

Ogkpe94cozMJuZJOWvY74A.text: I wish I listened to Nelson Q's review. Spot on!!!  I was extremely disappointed with the food here. While it wasn't necessarily terrible, it was not good. And what's worse, it was WAY overpriced! $16 for a few pieces of catfish (eh), lame ass Mac n cheese, watery potato salad. The corn bread muffin was dis-gus-ting!!!! However, the fried okra was pretty damn good. I liked that best.  The catfish had nice enough flavor but wasn't crispy and delicious like I was expecting. The Mac and cheese was worse than a box. I mean horrible. So much so, they should stop making it. ($7 for a large side......whaaaaaaaat!!!!!!) I didn't care for the potato salad. Had huge chunks of egg whites in it. Ew. Me no likey.  And, it was watery. How the hell is potato salad watery?? The corn bread muffin was embarrassing. How can you mess that up? This place is closer to 1 star, but the okra was pretty tasty. Beware if you come here. Keep your expectations low and you might enjoy.
