QAjxAXUknOVQqYUDrjrbGg.text: This is hands down the best soul food in Vegas. My husband and I have been here 10 times. The food is True southern cooking, not too salty, seasoned just right!! I can't even tell you what to get EVERYTHING we've ordered has been spot on.  The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is related to their to go service. We have ordered take out 3 times, all those times they forgot to put the cornbread in the bag! There cornbread is DELICIOUS!! If you've ever had it, you understand my frustration! No biggie tho, I should've learned my lesson after the first n started checking the bag,  now if we order to go, we check the bag before we leave.  The staff is always friendly. M8N9YGdgafALezWbedTWVQ.text: On the positive side. the original proprietor and I share the same birthday. The staff was pleasant.   I wanted this place to be good, I really did. It was ok. Not good, not bad. The greens were bland. The barbecue was nothing write home about and lacked meat on the bones. The cornbread was dry. The catfish wasn't flavorful. The food, overall was greasy in a bad way.  I did enjoy the black-eyed peas.  I'm sorry, just had much better.

5G-sftP-_pibWrNW9q12fg.text: I've been waiting to try this place for some time now but never had the time to stop in. Today I went in for lunch and had the catfish. I've been living in Vegas for 17 years now and this place by far has the best catfish I've ever tried. It comes with a variety of sides ( I chose potato salad and Black Eyed Peas) which where also amazing. If you want some good home cooked soul food definitely have to come try this place out. I will be back again for sure. The service was outstanding and the food was beyond explainable good....

szNfiBT8MVMLdqjwvreJGQ.text: Fo Shizzle my chicken Dizzle...  I like this place!  The place is fairly basic inside, kind of a retro - modern vibe too it.  It is set up more like a quick serve place but it has waitress service.  The service was friendly and homey.  They had some lunch specials for $8 or more.  The Fried chicken special was $8 for 2 pieces and 2 sides.  I had mac and cheese & greens... I almost ordered 2 sides of greens --- Iove greens.  The fried chicken was good.  Very lightly breaded, crispy skin and juicy on the inside.  The seasoning on the fried chicken was a little boring but the chicken was cooked just right.  I did experience an unpleasant bite when there seemed to be a nugget of salt all in one bite.  I guess that happens sometimes.  The mac and cheese was pretty good.  The greens were tender and full of flavor.  Soul food has a ton of salt in it, just in my opinion the salt could be toned down.  Of course, I wouldn't mess with a family recipe that has been passed down through the generations just because some Asian guy said something on Yelp.  While I was eating the chicken I looked at my fingers and they didn't have any grease on them.  I realized that the chicken was not greasy at all.  Just crispy & Juicy.  The $8 lunch special over all was excellent.  The portions were generous.  The food was way above average soul food.  I would prefer a real piece of cornbread instead of the little muffin they serve.  I will go back fo sho!

VKwyUQwrDn6yjwOtw-WfcQ.text: Tradition. That is what this cute soul food cafe is steeped in. The menu is a tribute to a lovely NOLA influenced granny, RIP, who lived to the ripe old age of 97 1/2 and who apparently was a gifted cook.  These are her recipes. Consider yourself honored to meet her through her granddaughter's perseverence to share her food.  Located on the north end of town, near Nellis AFB, this is a very attractive, clean, spacious eating establishment that should be taken seriously by locals and travellers as well. It is desireable not only for the food but for its location far from the craziness that is downtown and on the Strip. This is in the land of copius parking and chill attitude.  The Catfish has a lovely cornmeal crunch, not at all greasy. It comes with great tasting tartar sauce and your choice of 3 sides.  The servings were so big I felt I was looking at them thru a magnifying glass.  The braised oxtail came with 3 pcs as big as a fist and a choice of two sides. The meat was fall off the bone tender, and the pan gravy was plate lickable.  Even the cornbread muffin was unique with an interesting crusty muffin top. Served with REAL butter.  My mac n cheese side (oh my goodness wonderful) was made exactly as I crave, with lots of the right kind of cheddar cheese.  The collard greens were tender and hammy and tangy. Oh so good.  Then there was the fried cabbage with bacon.  I could eat that all day long.  And yep, Mr B indulged in tasty Black Eyed Peas.  I didn't, but if you want to see what all the hype is over chitterlings, you don't have to go down South. They have them here.  They offer excellent service and a delightfully cheerful vibe.  You have no idea what authentic soul food is about until you come here.  I have tried many places, but this ranks #1 for me.  I would definitely go out of my way to eat here again.

ABf-QUbH9ppPFysDSGxtyQ.text: A local Las Vegas resident suggested that I try Ella Em's while in town.  He stated that it was recently voted Best Soul Food in Las Vegas.  So I ventured off the strip and made the $20 Uber ride to the North side.  I ordered the smothered pork chop entree which comes with three sides and cornbread.  Already too much food but I kept my sides safe as I really am not too adventurous with my soul food.  Not everyone from the South has good food.  My sides were the yams, fried cabbage, and macaroni and cheese.  Nothing was awesome.  The yams were out of a can but they tasted as if they added nutmeg to give it their own special touch.  The fried cabbage was too salty for me to enjoy.  And the macaroni and cheese was just...wrong.   My pork chops were three of the hugest slabs that I have ever seen.  They were the best part of my plate.  However, it made me wish that I ordered my beef gravy on the side; as they also were too salty.  It didn't take me long to get full with the huge portions and I ended up giving my leftovers to the beggar outside.

Maybe it's just my preference. Soul food is always a hard thing to do perfectly for others because you grow up with certain recipes or cooking it the way you love it. What I will say is...check your preference at the door and enjoy the food because it really is delicious.

I haven't tried the pork chop dinner yet, but it looks great and I'm excited to try it next time I'm in town. The wait staff is very friendly and helpful.

-zIu08LCFSNz0wDe162irw.text: I would have really, really LOVED to give EllaEm's five stars. Here's why I can't. We went last night for my grandmother's 79th birthday. I called ahead to let them know that a party of 8 would arrive at 6pm because I'd done some recon and saw it was a small place. We arrived on time, we're seated and greeted on entry. Our waitress took our drink orders and returned promptly. Here's when it goes south. It took 53 MINUTES from the time we ordered for any food to come out. Then they served 4 of our party. The rest of us had to wait another 28 MINUTES for our orders. By the time they brought our food, everyone else (who were starving after waiting almost an hour to eat) were almost done.  I knew based on the reviews that this place was a diceroll. Unfortunately on such an important occasion I crapped out. I was mad because I was the one that suggested this place. The food was AIIGHT but not bomb. The best thing about my meal (I ordered fried chicken, greens, and potato salad) was the potato salad.  Disappointed in so many ways because I live right around the corner and this could've been my family's soul food spot, but we will not be coming back, ever.

Not too oily, but still sinfully good -The country fried steak was just downright comfort on a plate. Very rich- I would recommend getting the chicken gravy over the brown gravy. I think the chicken gravy just goes better.  -Yams- amazing!! I would highly recommend this side. It's sweet almost like a sweet potato pie filling. I liked it because it almost served as a palate cleanser at the end of my meal & as dessert too! They had a tendency to play with their hair and not once thought about washing or sanitizing their hands. I brought it to their attention. They weren't happy with me but oh well.  Then a change of Shift and the scenario was completely different.  First let me say Thank You Ramon. You made our stay fabulous. When Ramon was working he sanitized the silverware. Whenever he worked with someone's food he always had gloves on and was extremely pleasant. Whenever he handled money he always sanitized afterwards. I am impressed.  The restaurant is extremely clean, a good find no doubt.  The food brought back memories I cherish if being back in Greensboro North Carolina at my Aunt Sadie's home at dinner time.  Everything that came to us was flavorful and absolutely delicious. Catfish and fried chicken, crispy and not greasy, an awesome cook. Cabbage cooked with bacon wow, red beans and rice right out of the south.  Out of all the things that make me mad is the fact that I haven't found it before today.  Be Warned I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Catfish, fresh mixed veggies, potato salad, red beans and rice. Heaven.

3p6lnJRHPjkdmcYMQLIHiQ.text: Really good southern food. Great place for all your cravings for soul food. Gotta give it up to miss ella em.

bPUv2AU8zaukatHQwI4YTw.text: Nice decor, very friendly staff. Service was quite good even with 70% or so occupancy. Catfish with greens and black eyed pease were right on point. I will go back.

Ino1lvn2Cfiz26uYJfAMIw.text: I typically don't write reviews but in this case, I'd have to. My family of 5 came in as soon as the place opened. It took us over an hour to get our food. With 3 little kids, that didn't go so well. There was only 1 waitress for the entire place. During the time we were waiting on our food, there were 2 different group of customers that walked out because of how slow everything was.  I ordered the oxtail, which was pretty tasty (a bit salty for my taste though). My husband ordered the fried fish, wasn't too bad and my oldest ordered the chicken and waffles, which I found disappointing as 3 or 4 chicken wings were given(I was expecting big chicken pieces for the price we paid), scrambled eggs and a stack of waffles. Everything was a bit pricey. If you're craving for soul food, I'd recommend this place; however, I don't think I'll be back again due to lack of good service and long wait.

FkxKu_-flUni9c8IyhCQdw.text: OMG! I havent found this kind of "mama's" cookin since I left GA. Everything was PERFECT! BEST chicken fried steak ever, so crispy & juicy. Fried cat fish falls apart at 1st bite & batter stays on til last bite. Yams is like Thanksgiving heaven. Mashed potatoes are so smooth. Mac n cheese is loaded w cheese. Can't go wrong with fluffy rice & chicken gravy. LOVE LOVE LOVE it here! Very cute decor inside for sweet date night (especially rainy day) Service was friendly. Always coming back! :)

q9RR-4vZHOzFme2-UZJ9ag.text: The best soul food I had in Vegas by far so if your in Vegas you might want to make the effort to get some good soul food

photos.caption: Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States

D-EFEULVv3gNxU_u6ysBsg.text: I guess the thing that messes things up for ElllaEm's is that I grew up on soul food in L.A. and it's simply better than any I've had in LV....M & Ms, Roscoe's Chicken N Waffles, Aunt Kizzy's Back Porch, Harold & Belles...you hear me knockin'?  Went with the chicken  and waffles and they were ok.  The chicken needs more seasoning and there needs to be a few more pieces on the plate. The waffle needs to be pumped up some because they are a bit on the thin side and not too flavorful. I would recommend there be a host/ hostess  posted  at the entrance because when you walk in you don't know what to do. Do I wait  for a server or do I just pick my own seat?  Service needs to be faster as well, we waited far too long  for the amount of food we ordered.   Now, me and my out of town guests  were dead set on trying the peach cobbler but they said they ran out. I love cobbler so I tried again on Sunday and they ran out again. Still have not tried the cobbler.  I think EllaEm's excels at their sides. The yams are some of the best anywhere. The collard greens are excellent and the fried cabbage is pure perfection. However,  the mac n cheese was just ok.   Prices are reasonable  and parking is really good. There are several other good eateries within this shopping center as well. For first timers I recommend ordering the pork chops, collard greens, yams and the cobbler......if you can find it.

-F95EDZSg__LePlN4GljtQ.text: It was my first time to dine there last week, I just have to say that the service, and especially the food, was excellent!!! Anisha, my server extraordinaire, was just lovely! She was very knowledgable about the entire menu, extremely accommodating, and was so much sweeter than my sweet tea! I will definitely come back, with even more friends next time! I think I've found myself a new soul food hang out! My goal is to try everything on the menu, and eventually go back and make a few favorites! The place may be far away from my house, but it is definitely worth the trip! For that kind of food, and with that amazing service, you will be coming back for more! It'll feed your belly and your soul! Much love, EllaEm's staff! (Especially to Anisha!!!) Can't wait to go back!!!

Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly fried chicken, black eyed peas, collard greens &amp; yams!!! Just get over there and try it!!! You&#39;ll love it!!!

CcVJl0OfU58abIsSCtMufw.text: First time here. Service was great and the food was good! We had the oxtail dinner and meatloaf lunch special. The fried cabbage was spectacular! Sweet Tea wasn't great but I will definitely come back again!

LXbNT8qWVJ_KymWu677hKw.text: This small cafe has all the right ingredients-nicely decorated, friendly staff and great food!  I ordered food to go and it was bagged up fresh and hot.  I had the chicken fried steak with gravy, macaroni and cheese and collard greens.  It was truly delicious! I would have give it 5 stars but for the cornbread.  I was expecting a large square and only got a small circular piece.  A big piece of cornbread would have topped off the perfect meal!  Will definitely go again and again.

9r4xl2Vg1aoEIUhDbyjlHQ.text: Had dinner here with my daughter, the food and service was great! Very clean, has a nice southern atmosphere,  we were greeted as soon as we stepped in, enjoyed the music. Definitely will be returning!

pMVwuQ0vscTKWS39uyplyg.text: Yum. Yum. Yum. So glad we stopped in. We were looking for a great fried chicken meal and we found it. Everything is homemade and delicious. We'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of EllaEm's Soul Food - North Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too much food...and, that&#39;s a good thing. Everything was fresh and homemade. The cabbage was soo good and MAC cheese old school

GtawVEHbfzC3idGJD-HsxA.text: EllaEm's is a great to eat!!! The people are very nice and helpful. The food is wonderful!!!! I will definitely eat there again and again!!!

WgohCJXyMQBf2kzUfr-twQ.text: This place was on our radar for some time, but we kept putting other places ahead of it. We were first in as the doors opened, it's a small place, all tables, the menu was your basic "southern" one with everything from smothered chicken, to oxtails and meatloaf.   I ordered the meatloaf and it came with three sides, I picked the mac n cheese, the collard greens and black eyed peas. The slice of meatloaf was about 1/2 inch thick but very small compared to most.   The sides were pretty good, the exception was the mac n cheese, it wasn't very thick cheesy, but runny and not much cheese flavor. Corn bread served with the meal was sweet cake kind, served warm. I liked the meal, but I grew up in the south, and we ate pretty good, the portions were large and filled up our plate, this plate was bare in places, so it made me think, they must be a little stingy with the servings.

lVvnr73EQTrsFd-chhXw1g.text: On February 7, 2015 My business partners & I went to EllaEm's for dinner. We were told by Ms. Allyson they were closing & we'd have to place to go orders. Since we were hungry we said ok. Thankfully she had a change of heart & seated us. Between the four of us we ordered fried red snapper, oxtails, fried chicken, greens, yams, rice & gravy, potato salad, black eye peas and mac & cheese. The meal also came with corn muffins that were great for breakfast the next day :-) Everything was yummy!! We all left full, fat & satisfied. Thanks Allyson & Q for making our visit to Vegas all worth it. Great service. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.
